New Market Expansion: Lead the credit risk aspects of product expansion into new markets, ensuring successful and sustainable growth.
Stakeholder Management: Communicate effectively with diverse stakeholders, including market leadership, internal finance teams, investors, and others, to ensure alignment between credit risk strategy and overall business objectives.
Continuous Improvement: Proactively challenge and refine existing credit risk strategies and processes, driving a culture of continuous improvement.
Data-Driven Decision Making: Leverage data analysis and modeling techniques to inform credit risk decisions and strategy development.

4170840170.title: Financial Analyst

4153204856.title: Risk Analyst
4153204856.description:
About the job
¿Estás buscando dar un paso más en tu carrera profesional?

Buscamos Risk Analyst con experiencia en IFRS9 y programación en SAS, SQL o Pyhton para trabajar con nuestro cliente, una importante compañía del sector financiero, especializada en soluciones de pago, financiación y servicios digitales. (Contratación el cliente final)

¿Qué harás?
Desarrollo, actualización y backtesting de modelos de riesgo (PD, LGD, EAD).
Manipulación de datos, incluyendo la construcción y mantenimiento de data marts.
Implementación, monitoreo y análisis del marco de reportes (regulatorios e internos).
Análisis de calidad de datos.
Gestión de proyectos locales e internacionales.
Preparación de documentación y presentaciones corporativas.
Ejecución del proceso de provisiones IFRS9.
Realización de análisis de riesgo relacionados con la manipulación de datos.
Garantizar la creación y actualización de procedimientos relacionados con el cálculo y monitoreo de provisiones IFRS9.

¿Qué buscan?
Experiencia en programación con SAS, SQL o Python.
Conocimientos básicos en gestión del riesgo crediticio.
Inglés fluido.
Atención al detalle y enfoque en la entrega de soluciones pragmáticas y viables.

¿Qué se ofrece?
Contrato indefinido por parte del cliente final (no subcontratación)
Salario hasta 45K (dependiendo de experiencia)
Teletrabajo híbrido con 2 días en la oficina a la semana en Madrid.
Oportunidad de trabajar en proyectos variados y desafiantes.
Desarrollo profesional y formación continua.
Ambiente de trabajo colaborativo y de apoyo.
Paquete completo de beneficios para empleados.

4136737942.title: Pricing Analyst
4136737942.description:
About the job
Analista de Pricing Grupo Fire

Sobre Grupo Fire:
Grupo Fire es un líder destacado en la industria de protección contra incendios en España, contando con más de 300 profesionales, una base de clientes que supera los 50,000, y operaciones en seis regiones. Conocidos por nuestro compromiso con la seguridad y la calidad, estamos en constante expansión y evolución para satisfacer las necesidades de nuestros clientes y del mercado.

Estamos creciendo y en 2025 seremos la principal compañía de protección contra incendios en España.

Descripción del Puesto:
Buscamos un Analista de Pricing Estratégico que se especialice en la utilización de grandes bases de datos de clientes para identificar patrones de precios y oportunidades de optimización. Este rol es clave para maximizar la rentabilidad y retención de clientes mediante ajustes estratégicos en la estructura de precios.

Responsabilidades Clave:
Analizar extensas bases de datos de clientes para identificar patrones y tendencias en precios por tipo de cliente, servicio, área geográfica y tamaño de cliente.
Desarrollar modelos predictivos para determinar oportunidades de incremento de precios y evaluar el impacto potencial en la retención y rentabilidad.
Trabajar en conjunto con los equipos de operaciones y comerciales para implementar aumentos de precios y asegurar su aceptación en el mercado.
Monitorizar y evaluar el impacto de los ajustes de precios en la retención de clientes y la rentabilidad global de la empresa.
Realizar seguimiento continuo y análisis de la correlación entre incrementos de precios y cambios en la dinámica del mercado y comportamiento del cliente.

Calificaciones:
Título universitario en Economía, Finanzas, Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería Industrial o campo relacionado.
Al menos 3-5 años de experiencia en análisis de datos o roles analíticos financieros, con un fuerte enfoque en análisis de bases de datos grandes.
Experiencia específica en roles de pricing, incluyendo el desarrollo de estrategias de precios y evaluación de su efectividad.
Experiencia en modelado de datos, análisis predictivo y herramientas analíticas avanzadas.
Competencia comprobada para trabajar con datos complejos y realizar análisis cuantitativos detallados.
Excelentes habilidades comunicativas, con fluidez en español e inglés.

Lo Que Ofrecemos:
Salario competitivo con compensación variable basada en el rendimiento.
Oportunidades de crecimiento acelerado en una empresa que está expandiendo su tamaño anualmente.
Un ambiente colaborativo con un equipo de alto calibre.
Formación continua y oportunidades de desarrollo profesional.

Proceso de Aplicación:
Los candidatos interesados deben enviar su currículum y una carta de presentación explicando sus calificaciones e interés en el puesto a hello@ibventur.es

Ubicación: Barcelona o Madrid, España
Tipo de Contrato: Tiempo completo, Indefinido
Fecha de Inicio: Inmediata

4173690486.title: Senior Credit Analyst
4173690486.description:
About the job
Job title – Credit Analyst (74084)

Location – Barcelona, Spain

Job model – Hybrid

We are seeking a dedicated professional with a passion for credit risk analysis. The role involves conducting comprehensive credit assessment, including the collection, examination, and interpretation of various data related to the existing and potential customers. The ideal candidate will be skilled in preparing and presenting credit recommendations to the decision-makers. Additionally, this role requires ongoing monitoring of accounts to identify, analyze and mitigate potential credit risks.

At dsm-firmenich, being a force for good is not optional. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion is a shared responsibility woven into our daily work to not only benefit our People, Customers & Communities but also drive business value. Equal access to opportunities is a given, belonging is a shared feeling, authenticity is celebrated.

Your Key Responsibilities

 Evaluate potential and existing clients using our credit model, which incorporates financial statements and qualitative data, to provide precise credit recommendations and ensure adherence to the credit group policy by all relevant stakeholders.
 Facilitate sales growth in complex countries and mid-markets by proposing credit risk mitigation solutions (such as trade finance) and closely monitoring accounts receivable to minimize write-offs in these regions.
 Oversee and approve the release of blocked sales orders after thorough analysis and validation.
 Develop and maintain strong partnerships with both external and internal stakeholders, including Business, Controlling, Customer Experience, and Collection Teams.
 Gain a deep understanding of the business, including its nature, growth strategy, customer types, country-specific factors, products, seasonality, sales organization structure, and global credit organization.
 Update and maintain process documentation and support the implementation of process improvements.

We bring

 A rich history and a promising future of bold scientific innovation and passionate creation with our customers;
 A space to grow by encouraging and supporting curiosity and an open mindset;
 A culture that prioritizes safety and well-being, both physically and mentally;
 The opportunity to work for a company where sustainability is much more than a claim and is core to our strategy and purpose;
 A flexible work environment that empowers people to take accountability for their work and own the outcome;
 Barrier-free communities within our organization where every employee is equally valued and respected – regardless of their background, beliefs, or identity;
 A firm belief that working together with our customers is the key to achieving great things;
 An eagerness to be one team and learn from each other to bring progress to life and create a better future;

You bring 

 University Degree or equivalent.
 Minimum of 3- 5 years of prior experience in credit management, accounting, or finance.
 Very good knowledge basis in financial ratios in order to provide accurate credit reports and recommendations.
 Maintain a positive attitude, flexible, good team player with ability to work independently and to multi-task.
 Proficiency in MS Office pack including Microsoft Excel tools and SAP knowledge.
 Fluent communication skills in English – both oral and written.
 Conversation level of Spanish

The application process

Interested in this position? Please apply on-line by uploading your resume in English via our career portal.

Equal Opportunities Commitment

dsm-firmenich is fully dedicated to inclusion because when people feel engaged and empowered, their creativity and innovation drives unprecedented progress. We aim to build a workplace where opportunity really is equal, so everyone can thrive. We do not discriminate: there’s a place for everyone at dsm-firmenich.

As a committed equal opportunity employer, we ensure our recruitment practices are inclusive and fair. We encourage the recruitment of a diverse workforce, representative of the communities in which we work, by using inclusive language, diverse interview panels, diversified sourcing strategies. Selection is based on qualifications, competency, experience, performance history and fit with the team to advance fair and equitable opportunity.

Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, backgrounds, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

We are committed to providing reasonable support for disabled applicants in our recruiting process. Should you need assistance, and are comfortable to share this, please let us know.

About Dsm-firmenich

As innovators in nutrition, health, and beauty, dsm-firmenich reinvents, manufactures, and combines vital nutrients, flavors, and fragrances for the world’s growing population to thrive. With our comprehensive range of solutions, with natural and renewable ingredients and renowned science and technology capabilities, we work to create what is essential for life, desirable for consumers, and more sustainable for the planet. dsm-firmenich is a Swiss-Dutch company, listed on the Euronext Amsterdam, with operations in almost 60 countries and revenues of more than €12 billion. With a diverse, worldwide team of nearly 30,000 employees, we bring progress to life™ every day, everywhere, for billions of people. www.dsm-firmenich.com

Pease note this is a direct search led by dsm-firmenich. We only accept applications from candidates, not from agencies nor subject to agency’s fees, percentages or similar.

 A space to grow by encouraging and supporting curiosity and an open mindset;

 A firm belief that working together with our customers is the key to achieving great things;
 An eagerness to be one team and learn from each other to bring progress to life and create a better future;

4149148325.title: Senior FP&A Analyst
4149148325.description:
About the job
Role Purpose

We are seeking an experienced Senior FP&A Analyst to join our finance team. The ideal candidate will play a critical role in financial planning, budgeting, forecasting, and strategic decision-making. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to provide data-driven insights, optimize financial performance, and support executive leadership with strategic recommendations.

Primary Responsibilities

Lead budgeting and forecasting processes, ensuring accuracy and alignment with business objectives.
Develop financial models to support strategic decision-making, scenario planning, and long-term growth initiatives.
Provide rolling forecasts and variance analysis to track performance against budget and prior periods.
Analyze financial results, identify key drivers, and provide actionable insights to senior management.
Develop KPI dashboards and reports to monitor business performance and drive operational efficiency.
Partner with various departments to analyze costs, revenue trends, and profitability.
Preparing business cases to support new investment, strategic and other business decisions
Reviewing existing processes and procedures to develop recommendations for improvement efforts

Knowledge & Skills

Excellent verbal and written communication skills both in English and spanish
Strong financial modelling skills
High level of proficiency with Microsoft Excel
Ability to work independently and as a team member with excellent interpersonal skills.
Strong project management and planning skills to successfully manage multiple, simultaneous projects.
Critical thinking, problem solving and decision making.
Willingness to learn, change status quo, and not take No for an answer.
Knowledge of the SQL language is an advantage.
Able to work effectively as a business partner with various stakeholders.

Benefits

💪 Private health and dental insurance.
👟 Discounted gym membership.
💻 Freedom to work from home two days a week.
🍎 Kitchen with free coffee and fruit each Monday, Wednesday and Friday and snacks.
🌍 Team building activities and work in an international and passionate environment.

Don't miss the opportunity to be part of a company that values innovation and talent! Join us and take your career to the next level 🚀

4147651266.title: Financial Analyst
4147651266.description:
About the job
Hi! 👋🏼
At Shakers, we're on the lookout for a Financial Analyst to take our Finance team to the next level 🚀

1. Team and Role
If you have experience in Accounting and/or FP&A, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.
This role offers the opportunity to have a “360” experience of a Finance department within a fast-growing Startup. 
We, in Finance, are a small team with strong commitment and connections with the rest of the teams, so you will have the chance to learn and grow very fast, there are a lot of things to do!
If you’re excited by working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is the opportunity for you! 

2. What you´ll be doing

In your day-to-day as a Financial analyst you will work hand-to-hand and report to the Head of Finance to contribute to the main areas of the Finance team, mainly be:

Monthly closing procedure, you will work hand to hand with our accounting and tax advisory as well as with the billing team to close the books. This will include: 
Tax, you will be the main owner and contributor of our taxes compliance, this includes VAT (SII) and Retention, working closely with our tax advisory.
Contributor for the Annual Statutory Audit as well as Grants obtention or Due Diligence.
Contribute to any finance project that will arise because of Shakers International expansion starting 2025.
Accounts receivable and payable management with our customers and suppliers.
Resolve billing discrepancies as well as support with external customers platforms.Make sure that all the invoices are collected on time.
Review the bookings made by the accounting advisory and make sure everything is accurate.
Work with the billing team to make sure that all the transactional bookings are done correctly and ontime.
Do the analytical chart of accounts mapping as well as comparing Actuals vs Forecast.

3. What we´re looking for 
You´re a great fit if you...
Have 1-2 years of work experience in Audit firms, especially in Big 4, and/or 1-2 years of experience in a marketplace or SaaS startup.
Have a degree in Finance or Accounting.
Are knowledgeable and interested in the startup ecosystem.Have great communication skills to build relationships with the rest of the teams of the company and third parties.
Are familiar with KPIs, dashboards, and analytics. Have a data-driven profile.
Are proactive &; take ownership of your projects and responsibilities.
Have a high level of English both spoken and written.

4. What's in it for you?
Compensation 💰The salary range for this position is between 26.000€ and 32.000€
The salary consists of:
Between 26.000€ & 28.000€ fixed salary
Up to 4.000€ yearly divided into quarterly bonus based on performance & potential (15%)

Why you´ll love working at Shakers 💚
Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. 🌍
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture—ask anyone on our team!Take advantage of our fully flexible methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Velázquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance and more.
At the office... 📍
Organic fruit
Free caffeine and theine


5. Our recruitment process
As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process. Our goal is to have you onboard this March, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one! 
The Road to Joining Our Team:
Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don’t worry—we just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Finance Team: Join two members of our Finance Team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your recruiting skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check, CEO Chat: Meet Héctor, our CEO! He’s excited to connect with you over a coffee, talk about Shakers’ future, and discuss your vision and expectations.

More about Shakers
At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working. Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology. We are a 45-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!

Our DNA
At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!
WINNING TEAM 🏆We all feel like part of a winning team—one that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.
F1C10 💪🏼We’re building an environment where fear doesn’t hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren’t afraid to go big!
STAY HUMBLE 🤲🏼We embrace a beginner’s mindset—always evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary! 

A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see

you soon.

4151284958.title: Quality Analyst (FinCrime)
4151284958.description:
About the job
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

The Financial Crime Operations department is at the forefront of Revolut’s efforts to keep customers and their money safe. These special agents work directly with customers to resolve issues and flag potential concerns. Using cutting-edge technology, we aim to prevent financial crime in a way the financial world hasn’t seen so far.

We're looking for a FinCrime Quality Analyst to join our Compliance team. You’ll be in charge of getting to the bottom of customer issues, working closely with other colleagues to investigate fraud cases, and always delivering an outstanding customer experience.

We’re a global fintech, so we have to be available 24/7. That sometimes means working nights and weekends. We’ll compensate you for night shifts, but we understand this still isn’t for everyone so please bear that in mind before applying.

What You’ll Be Doing

Completing monthly Quality Control (QC) activities by focusing on identifying successes and failures in compliance teams work
Highlighting and reporting any issues to Quality Control and FinCrime managers
Providing feedback to analysts and identifying root-cause analyses of errors
Delivering refresher sessions to analysts struggling with quality performance
Coaching new joiners
Learning all procedures across the compliance department
Collaborating with other teams across different locations
Carrying out ad-hoc duties as required

What You'll Need

1+ years of experience in a compliance-related function
Good AML knowledge
A solid understanding of compliance issues and regulatory requirements within financial services, including key processes, practices, systems, and controls
High attention to detail
Impressive analytical skills
Readiness to take ownership and responsibility
Fluency in English with excellent communication skills
Flexibility with responsibilities and a positive attitude towards changes to role, objectives, priorities, and targets

Nice to have

Fluency in another language
Practical knowledge of Google Suite

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.

 Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
 Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.

We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

4165415209.title: Credit Risk Analyst USA & Brazil
4165415209.location: El Prat de Llobregat, Catalonia, Spain
4165415209.description:
About the job
At PRONOVIAS GROUP, we believe every wedding and special occasion is unique, and we love being part of those magical moments. If you're excited by fashion, luxury, and want to work in a creative and elegant environment, this is the place for you.

We are currently looking for a professional and talented O2C Credit Collection Specialist to join our Operations team.

Duties & Responsibilities

Managing credit collections operations for the Americas region and Brasil, with the principal goal of protecting the assets of the company, by balancing exceptional customer service whilst maximizing cash flow through cash collection.
Act as a true Pronovias Group Ambassador by building strong and efficient collaboration relations both with customers and with all the departments involved (Customer Service, Logistics, Sales, etc.)
Provide recommendations regarding collection strategy effectiveness, including orders & cash allocation, billing, credit limits, claims & accounts receivable monitoring, loan management and market reporting, deploying strategies that contribute to the Company’s mission.

Requirements

Bachelor's Degree Business Administration (or related field).
At least 2-4 years of work experience in Customer & Credit Management.
Strong client-facing and communication skills.
Excellent knowledge of the Microsoft Office Package.
Team player; enthusiastic, accurate and commercially oriented.
Hands-on mentality and a proactive attitude towards work.
Advanced in English and Portuguese spoken and written.
Fix schedule from 3pm to 11pm (no split shift).
Ability to think strategically and to lead a dynamic team.
Advanced troubleshooting and multi-tasking skills.
Customer service orientation and passion for the Bridal Industry.

A Few Things You'll Love About Us

Join our ethical and diverse workplace, where being YOU is what makes us extraordinary! You’ll have the chance to get involved in our CSR strategy, which is all about empowering women, protecting the environment, and making a real impact in the community.
You can join our flexible benefits plan, including health insurance, transport tickets, nursery school vouchers, and training opportunities to grow with us.
Enjoy our subsidized company canteen with delicious meals and breakfast to keep you fueled for success!
We’re all about building a strong, positive culture with team-building activities that reflect our values: respect, innovation, empowerment, performance, and teamwork.
And don’t worry about parking – we’ve got you covered with private parking and a company shuttle bus from Barcelona and El Prat de Llobregat.
PRONOVIAS GROUP
O2C Credit Collection Specialist
Duties & Responsibilities
Managing credit collections operations for the Americas region and Brasil, with the principal goal of protecting the assets of the company, by balancing exceptional customer service whilst maximizing cash flow through cash collection.
Act as a true Pronovias Group Ambassador by building strong and efficient collaboration relations both with customers and with all the departments involved (Customer Service, Logistics, Sales, etc.)
Provide recommendations regarding collection strategy effectiveness, including orders & cash allocation, billing, credit limits, claims & accounts receivable monitoring, loan management and market reporting, deploying strategies that contribute to the Company’s mission.
Managing credit collections operations for the Americas region and Brasil, with the principal goal of protecting the assets of the company, by balancing exceptional customer service whilst maximizing cash flow through cash collection.
Act as a true Pronovias Group Ambassador by building strong and efficient collaboration relations both with customers and with all the departments involved (Customer Service, Logistics, Sales, etc.)
Provide recommendations regarding collection strategy effectiveness, including orders & cash allocation, billing, credit limits, claims & accounts receivable monitoring, loan management and market reporting, deploying strategies that contribute to the Company’s mission.
Requirements
Bachelor's Degree Business Administration (or related field).
At least 2-4 years of work experience in Customer & Credit Management.
Strong client-facing and communication skills.
Excellent knowledge of the Microsoft Office Package.
Team player; enthusiastic, accurate and commercially oriented.
Hands-on mentality and a proactive attitude towards work.
Advanced in English and Portuguese spoken and written.
Fix schedule from 3pm to 11pm (no split shift).
Ability to think strategically and to lead a dynamic team.
Advanced troubleshooting and multi-tasking skills.
Customer service orientation and passion for the Bridal Industry.

Join our ethical and diverse workplace, where being YOU is what makes us extraordinary! You’ll have the chance to get involved in our CSR strategy, which is all about empowering women, protecting the environment, and making a real impact in the community.
You can join our flexible benefits plan, including health insurance, transport tickets, nursery school vouchers, and training opportunities to grow with us.
Enjoy our subsidized company canteen with delicious meals and breakfast to keep you fueled for success!
We’re all about building a strong, positive culture with team-building activities that reflect our values: respect, innovation, empowerment, performance, and teamwork.
And don’t worry about parking – we’ve got you covered with private parking and a company shuttle bus from Barcelona and El Prat de Llobregat.

4096793895.title: Commercial Analyst Junior
4096793895.description:
About the job
Para nuestro departamento de Finanzas reportando a nuestra Business Planning Manager buscamos a un/a Commercial Analyst Junior

La misión del puesto será planificar la construcción del presupuesto anual y supervisar el desempeño del área comercial de Lyreco respecto a los objetivos financieros acordados para detectar riesgos y oportunidades ayudando a lograr los objetivos de negocio.

Funciones principales:

Tener el conocimiento adecuado tanto del mercado, como de la Compañía y de su cultura, que permita proponer y ejecutar acciones de mejora en la gestión del día a día apoyando al negocio.
Conocer y entender los diferentes modelos de negocio según categoría de ventas, así como su impacto en la información económica-financiera, con el objetivo de analizar la cuenta de resultados de las mismas.
Implementar la cuenta de resultados de Nuevo Negocio asegurando la veracidad de las hipótesis, circuito de validación y seguimiento post mortem con marketing.
Analizar los resultados de Lyreco Iberia comparado con los objetivos acordados para identificar posibles desviaciones y entender el impacto de las decisiones focalizando en las ventas y el margen comercial, proponiendo medidas correctoras a futuro.
 Ejecutar el proceso presupuestario anual de las áreas asignadas y colaborar en la coordinación y consolidación de todos los entregables de los departamentos involucrados, según requerimientos de Grupo.
 Coordinación del forecast mensual ventas y margen comercial con los diferentes heads y Regionales, identificando y comunicando los riesgos y oportunidades al Business Planning Manager y a la Dirección Financiera.
 Analizar las ventas y el margen comercial de la compañía desde la visión cliente y categoría de producto
Preparación de Business Case de nuevos procesos de negocio identificando riesgos y oportunidades, así como necesidad de cambios en los procesos habituales de compañía que se deberán contemplar en el Business Case y hacer seguimiento y análisis post mortem de estos una vez implementados.
 Ejecutar los procesos necesarios para realizar un control de gestión en las áreas de la cuenta de resultados gestionados por Finanzas según las instrucciones del Business Planning Manager.
Ejecutar la revisión mensual de OPEX de los departamentos asignados y análisis por naturaleza de gasto identificando los riesgos y oportunidades.
Realizar análisis ad-hoc según requerimiento del Business Planning Manager.
Obtener un conocimiento adecuado del área operativa para poder ser backup del Corporate Services Business Analyst.
Crear informes y reportes personalizados y estandarizados, basados en la información de los sistemas de la compañía Clickview (BING), IBM Planning Analytics (LPA) para el análisis de datos cuantitativos y de los diversos KPIs para ayudar a la toma de decisiones.
Asegurar la transparencia y fiabilidad de los datos operativos y financieros, y que el negocio cumple los controles operativos y financieros marcados en las políticas y procedimientos de Grupo.


Requisitos

Grado en Empresariales/ADE/Economía
Conocimientos de contabilidad y auditoría.
Idiomas: Necesario nivel medio de inglés equivalente a un First Certificate.
Nivel avanzado de Excel/Word/PWP/Outlook y SAP.
Se valorará experiencia en el uso de Power BI.
Experiencia mínima de 2 años en departamento financiero o comercial desarrollando funciones de análisis financiero o bien 2 años de Auditoria interna/externa.


Ofrecemos:

Proyecto estable
Jornada Completa
Ubicación puesto de trabajo en: Cornellá de Llobregat, Barcelona, España.
Nivel valoración puesto Hay: 11
Beneficios sociales exclusivos Lyreco:
 Conciliación (Posibilidad de trabajar en remoto)
 Salud y bienestar (seguros, bienestar laboral y snack saludable cada mes)
 Descuentos para empleados
 Desarrollo profesional
 Programas de reconocimiento interno
 Dia libre el día de tu cumpleaños

4173565752.title: Analista Jr Finanzas
4173565752.description:
About the job
Join Ibancar as a Junior Corporate Finance & FP&A Analyst – Accelerated Program!
Who are we?
At Ibancar World, we are an international leader in car-backed loans. Our unique approach of not repossessing the vehicle, not changing its ownership, and not charging rental fees has allowed us to improve the lives of thousands of clients. We’re growing, and we want you to be part of this mission!
Do you want to accelerate your career in corporate finance and learn directly from top management? We are looking for a Junior Analyst with strong analytical and logical skills, eager to dive into an intensive development program working closely with the CFO and the Finance Manager.
This is not a traditional operational role. From day one, you will be involved in high-impact strategic projects, with structured rotations through key areas: FP&A, accounting, treasury, and financial analysis.
 What are we looking for?
A dynamic, proactive, committed, responsible individual who is eager to learn every day.
 Your responsibilities will include:
´
Working directly with the CFO and Finance Manager on strategic decision-making.
Financial analysis and modeling: Evaluating proposals, profitability analysis, and cost optimization.
FP&A and financial planning: Creating and tracking budgets, forecasts, and variance analysis.
Accounting and treasury: Managing cash flow, reconciliations, and financial reporting.
Reporting and dashboards: Automating and structuring financial reports for decision-making.
Interaction with internal teams and stakeholders: Collaborating with business areas to optimize financial processes and strategies.
Participation in strategic projects: Opportunity to be involved in key initiatives for company growth.
 What we need from you:
A minimum of 1-2 years of experience in Finance (required).
Advanced Excel skills (financial models and report automation).
Advanced English and Spanish (essential, as you will interact with international stakeholders).
Strong analytical and logical ability for modeling scenarios and evaluating data.
Problem-solving skills.
 Work schedule:
Full-time, on-site position (40 hours per week).
Hours: 9:00 to 17:00.
 What we offer:
An inclusive, diverse, and discrimination-free work environment.
Opportunities for professional development and job stability.
Excellent work culture.
Training programs.
At Ibancar, we value our people and ensure equal treatment and opportunities for all.
 Are you ready to accelerate your career with us?
Apply now and join a company that makes a difference!
__________________________________________________________________________________
Únete a Ibancar como ¡Analista Junior de Finanzas Corporativas & FP&A – Programa Acelerado!
¿Quiénes somos?
En Ibancar World, somos un referente internacional en préstamos con coche como aval. Nuestra propuesta única de no retirar el vehículo, no cambiar su titularidad y no cobrar alquiler por su uso nos ha permitido mejorar la vida de miles de clientes. ¡Estamos creciendo y queremos que seas parte de esta misión!
¿Quieres acelerar tu carrera en finanzas corporativas y aprender directamente de la alta dirección? Buscamos un Analista Junior con gran capacidad analítica y lógica, que quiera sumergirse en un programa de desarrollo intensivo trabajando codo a codo con el CFO y el Manager de Finanzas.
Esta no es una posición operativa tradicional. Desde el primer día, estarás involucrado en proyectos estratégicos de alto impacto, con una rotación estructurada por distintas áreas clave: FP&A, contabilidad, tesorería y análisis financiero.
 ¿Qué buscamos?
Una persona con experiencia dinámica, proactiva, comprometida, responsable y con ganas de aprender día a día.
 Tus responsabilidades serán:
Trabajar directamente con el CFO y el Manager de Finanzas en la toma de decisiones estratégicas.
Análisis financiero y modelización: Evaluación de propuestas, análisis de rentabilidad y optimización de costos.
FP&A y planeación financiera: Creación y seguimiento de presupuestos, forecast y análisis de variaciones.
Contabilidad y tesorería: Gestión del flujo de caja, conciliaciones y reportes financieros.
Reporting y dashboards: Automatización y estructuración de reportes financieros para toma de decisiones.
Interacción con equipos internos y stakeholders: Trabajo conjunto con áreas de negocio para optimizar procesos y estrategias financieras.
Participación en proyectos estratégicos: Oportunidad de involucrarte en iniciativas clave para el crecimiento de la empresa.
 Lo que necesitamos de ti:
Experiencia mínima de 1-2 años en Finanzas (excluyente).
Excel avanzado (modelos financieros y automatización de reportes)
Inglés y español avanzado (indispensable, interacción con stakeholders internacionales)
Gran capacidad analítica y lógica para modelizar escenarios y evaluar datos.
Habilidad para resolver problemas.
 Horario y jornada laboral:
Jornada completa presencial de 40 horas.
Horario: 9:00 a 17:00 horas.
 Lo que te ofrecemos:
Un entorno laboral inclusivo, diverso y libre de discriminación.
Oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y estabilidad laboral.
Excelente clima laboral.
Planes de formación.
En Ibancar, valoramos a nuestra gente y garantizamos igualdad de trato y oportunidades para todos.
 ¿Estás listo/a para acelerar tu carrera con nosotros?
¡Postula ahora y únete a una empresa que hace la diferencia!

4176140924.title: Analista Corporate Finance San Sebastián/Pamplona
4176140924.description:
About the job
En el equipo de Corporate Finance de NORGESTION buscamos incorporar un profesional con una experiencia anteror mínima de 3 años para nuestra oficina de San Sebastián y Pamplona. Estamos pensando en alguien que haya trabajado en Auditoria, Transaction Services, M&A, Deuda o Consultoria Estrategica en alguna "Big-Four", boutique financiera o firma de reconocido prestigio.

NORGESTION es una de las principales firmas independientes de asesoramiento financiero. Desde 1972, nuestra misión constante ha sido la de ofrecer a empresas y empresarios un servicio profesional y comprometido para la gestión y dirección de sus negocios y finanzas: buscar soluciones y conseguir resultados.

Pioneros en el desarrollo del Corporate Finance en España y tras años de seriedad, esfuerzo y compromiso es hoy una de las principales firmas líderes en el asesoramiento de operaciones corporativas en el Mid-Market.

Nuestra área de Corporate Finance cuenta con tres divisiones de negocio: (i) M&A asesoramiento en Fusiones y Adquisiciones (ii) Mercado de capitales (asesoramiento en mercado continuo, Asesores registrados en BME Growth y mercado alternativo de renta fija MARF) (iii) Debt Advisory (búsqueda de financiación, reestructuraciones y refinanciaciones, asesoramiento en “situaciones especiales”).

Responsabilidades:

Formando parte de un equipo, participará en la ejecución de proyectos de M&A típicamente mandatos de venta, compra, valoración de empresas, refinanciación de deuda etc participando en tareas como:

Elaboracion de pitches, notas ciegas, infomemos, informes de valoracion o refinanciación de deuda con apoyo y supervision de responsables.

Analisis de bases de datos e internet para obtención de información sectorial, de empresas y competidores necesarios para pitches o infodecks.

Analisis de soportes financieros, ( balances, PG, sumas y saldos) para la elaboración de información económico financiera típica en infomemos o IBRs.

Analisis de información de empresas para elaborar out puts de índole comercial, industrial, organizativo, estratégico que den contenido a materiales necesarios en operaciones típicas de M&A.

Elaboración de modelos financieros (proyecciones) necesarios para valoración de compañías o requeridos en infomemos o IBRs.

Elaboracion de soporte documental para proyectos de Corporate Finance ( valoraciones, venta-compra de empresas, restructuración de deuda).

Elaboración de soporte documental en proyectos de consultoria.

Tareas de apoyo en procesos de due dilligences, organizando la entrega de la información necesaria.



Requerimientos:

Formación ADE y preferiblemente especialidad en finanzas. Eventualmente Ingenieria de Organización en función de experiencia profesional.

Se valorará Master de especialidad en finanzas, auditoria o consultoría estratégica o en herramientas informáticas de BI.

Expediente académico alto.

Edad: entre 24 y 28 años.

Experiencia: Mínimo 3 años en Auditoria, Transaction Services, M&A, Deuda o Consultoria Estrategica.

Experiencia: Firmas solo en compañías big-four o boutiques financieras.

Residencia: Guipúzcoa o Navarra. Solo residentes en estas provincias aunque se pueden incluir de otras provincias pero que deseen volver a Guipuzcoa y Navarra tras experiencia laboral en Madrid, Barcelona,etc.

Idiomas: Inglés (mínimo C1) y se valoran otros idiomas como francés o alemán.

Manejo de excel y powerbi para dar cobertura al análisis financiero. Manejo de word y powerpoint para dar cobertura a la elaboración de informes de todo tipo.


Ofrecemos:

Contrato a tiempo completo con incorporación inmediata.

Participar en un entorno de trabajo dinámico, potenciando el desarrollo tanto profesional como personal.

Localización de las oficinas en San Sebastián: Avenida de la Libertad 17.
Localización de las oficinas en Pamplona: García Castañón, 8.

4168476703.title: Screening Analyst
4168476703.description:
About the job
Ebury is a leading global fintech company that empowers businesses to trade and grow internationally. It offers a comprehensive suite of products, including international payments and collections, FX risk management, trade finance, and API integrations. Founded in 2009 by Juan Lobato and Salvador García, Ebury is one of the fastest-growing global fintechs, with over 1,700 employees and 38 offices in more than 25 countries.

Screening Analyst

Work Pattern: 4 days a week working in the Leon office, 1 day working from home

We are looking for a Screening Analyst to join our Ebury Operations team in our Leon office. We are looking for candidates who are ambitious, bright and enthusiastic to develop their professional career in Finance. This is an excellent opportunity to join a rapidly growing, international company in a role which offers professional growth and career progression.

Responsibilities

Reviewing and/or investigating matches against sanctions, PEPs, adverse media and internal lists in a timely fashion and processing as appropriate
Conducting real-time and retrospective rules-based monitoring on client transactions and processing alerts as appropriate
Responding to Requests For Information on transactions from banking partners
Responding to queries from other internal departments
Complete allocated tasks with focus, and in a timely manner
Communicate the status of tasks to colleagues, supervisors and managers, and escalate problems swiftly, as needed
Adhere to all internal policies, processes and procedures

Requirements

Diligent, with good attention to detail and analytic mind
Proactive, with the ability to work within strict time-frames and under pressure
Working successfully in a target driven operational environment
Good communication skills, both written and verbal
Co-operative, and comfortable working in a team environment
Curious and eager to learn, and actively asks questions to confirm understanding of process and procedures
Adaptable, with the ability to cope with changing products, processes and procedures
Motivated, with a desire to make Ebury a success
Fluency in English, any other language is considered a real benefit
An understanding of AML principles is a plus.

About Us

Ebury is a FinTech success story, positioned among the fastest-growing international companies in its sector.

Founded in 2009, we are headquartered in London and have more than 1700 staff with a presence in more than 25 countries worldwide. Cultural diversity is part of what makes Ebury a special place to be. From Sao Paulo to Dubai, Bucharest to Toronto, we enjoy sharing team experiences and celebrating success across the Ebury family.

Hard work pays off: in 2019, Ebury received a £350 million investment from Banco Santander and has won internationally recognised awards including Financial Times: 1000 Europe's Fastest-Growing Companies.

None of this would have been possible without our proudest achievement: our great people. Enthusiastic, innovative and collaborative teams, always ready to disrupt and revolutionise the fast-paced FinTech sector.

We believe in inclusion. We stand against discrimination in all forms and have no tolerance for the intolerance of differences that makes us a modern and successful organisation. At Ebury, you can be whoever you want to be and still feel a sense of belonging no matter your story because we want you and your uniqueness to help write our future.

Please submit your application on the careers website directly, uploading your CV / resume in English.

4160167769.title: Credit Risk Analyst
4160167769.location: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
4160167769.description:
About the job
Continua nuestro legado y tradición: ¡únete a Europastry!

Formar parte del equipo Europastry supone querer continuar y evolucionar un legado y una tradición llevándolos a otro nivel. Significa ser un Baker y aportar un talento y valor únicos.

Europastry es un proyecto apasionante que mira al futuro sin perder de vista el pasado. Respetamos nuestros orígenes aprovechando el know-how adquirido durante casi cuatro décadas y, al mismo tiempo, tenemos la libertad y la pasión de reinventarnos e innovar cada día.

Somos una empresa global con presencia en más de 80 países donde diariamente cerca de 5.000 Bakers lideran el mercado de masas congeladas de panadería y bollería. Somos un equipo de valientes que arriesgamos, hacemos que las cosas pasen, y nos esforzamos por ofrecer el mejor producto a nuestros consumidores a través del mejor servicio a nuestros partners.

Somos #Brave #Agile #Keen #Engaged

We are Bakers. ¿Y tú? 

Tu misión en pocas palabras

En dependencia del Manager de Créditos, la persona incorporada, se responsabilizará de gestionar las cuentas y el crédito de toda la cartera de clientes asignada.

¿Cómo sería tu día a día? 

Gestión de toda la cartera de cuentas de clientes asignada y seguimiento de la deuda de cada una de ellas. 
Resolución de las incidencias derivadas de las discrepancias surgidas en la facturación de los clientes. 
Reclamación telefónica y por escrito a los clientes de los saldos vencidos o impagados de la cartera asignada. 
Colaboración con departamento comercial y de atención al cliente con el objetivo de garantizar la puntualidad en los pagos de los clientes. 
Colaboración en la redacción de los informes de gestión de crédito para su posterior reporte. 
Archivo de los documentos de contabilización gestionados y de los trámites administrativos realizados. 

Que buscamos en un/a Baker

Formación académica: Formación académica de FP II Administrativo o CFGS Administración y Finanzas o Diplomatura en Empresariales. 
Idiomas: Imprescindible conocimiento de inglés con mínimo nivel B2.
Experiencia: Necesaria experiencia de un mínimo de 3 años en posición similar. 
Conocimientos: manejo avanzado de Excel 
Extras: Muy valorable disponer de conocimientos de JDE y aportar experiencia en una empresa del sector de Gran Consumo. 

¿Por qué unirte a nuestro equipo? 

Oportunidades para el crecimiento profesional dentro de un equipo internacional. 
Plan de compensación flexible que incluye seguro de salud, guardería, transporte y comida, adaptado a tus necesidades. Además, incluye un seguro para tu mascota, 
Acceso exclusivo a la plataforma Bakers Vip Club, con descuentos en ocio y consumo solo para nuestros colaboradores. 
Subvención en el menú de cantina, para que disfrutes de la comida a un coste reducido. 
Desayuno Europastry: ¡Empieza tu día con nuestros mejores productos! 
Descuento exclusivo para empleados en nuestros productos de Europastry. 
Acceso a gimnasio y pistas de pádel del recinto para mantener tu bienestar físico! 
Viernes tarde con horario intensivo. 
Lockers disponibles.

En Europastry, ofrecemos un espacio de trabajo diverso e inclusivo donde todas las personas se sientan valoradas y respetadas. Estamos comprometidos con prácticas de contratación justas y equitativas, implementamos programas de formación para asegurar que toda nuestra plantilla conozca y esté comprometida con estos principios.

Estamos interesados en el valor único que puedes aportar a nuestro equipo, independientemente de cualquier otro aspecto. Por favor, envía un CV que destaque tus logros profesionales y habilidades. No es necesario incluir fotografías ni datos personales que no sean relevantes para la evaluación de tu candidatura.

¿Te gustaría ser Baker?
Continua nuestro legado y tradición: ¡únete a Europastry!

4166878266.title: Finance Analyst
4166878266.description:
About the job
Company: REVER

Location: Barcelona, Spain

Type: Full-Time

Start Date: March

About REVER

We’re redefining returns and refunds. REVER was born to change how the world buys, ensuring returns are as effortless as purchases. Backed by YCombinator, leading VCs, and founders from unicorn companies across Europe, we are in an exciting phase of rapid growth and product-market fit. With ambitious goals to expand globally, we are looking for passionate individuals to help us revolutionize the customer experience.

Role Overview

We are looking for a highly analytical and detail-oriented Finance Analyst to join our growing team. This role is ideal for someone with experience in finance / audit, venture capital (VC), private equity (PE), and corporate finance, with a keen interest in start-ups. The Finance Analyst will support REVER’s founders in investor discussions, prepare financial reports, and assist in fundraising efforts. Additionally, this role will involve financial administration and support for REVER’s clients, working closely with the product and operations teams.

You Will

Support the founders in investor conversations by preparing financial models, reports, and key metrics.
Assist in fundraising efforts, including preparing investment materials and conducting financial analysis.
Develop and maintain financial reporting for internal and external stakeholders.
Work closely with the product and operations teams to provide financial support to clients.
Ensure accurate and timely financial data collection, analysis, and reporting.
Assist in budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning to support business growth.
Provide insights on financial performance and suggest improvements based on data analysis.

You Have

2-4 years of experience in finance, venture capital, private equity, investment banking, or corporate finance.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Proficiency in financial modeling, Excel, and data analysis tools.
Experience in preparing financial reports and investment materials.
Ability to work with large datasets and extract meaningful insights.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to interact with investors and stakeholders.
A proactive and entrepreneurial mindset, with the ability to work independently.
Interest in start-ups, fundraising, and corporate finance.

Why Should You Join Us?

Be part of a fast-growing company backed by top-tier investors.
Work closely with REVER’s leadership team on high-impact financial initiatives.
Gain hands-on experience in investor relations and fundraising.
Work in a dynamic, international environment based in the heart of Barcelona.
Enjoy a competitive salary, benefits, and professional growth opportunities.
Help revolutionize the e-commerce and reverse logistics space by making returns as seamless as purchases.

4172016536.title: Financial Planning and Analysis Sr. Analyst (FP&A)
4172016536.description:
About the job
Noatum is an Abu Dhabi Ports company providing integral logistics solutions with over Eur 1.5bn revenue and over 4,5000 employees.

Noatum provides services to ship owners and operators as well as exporters and importers and is present in more 30 countries with a strong presence in North America, South America, Europe, North Africa, the Arabian Gulf and Asia.

We are currently looking for a stable incorporation of a F&PA for our Noatum Terminals area The vacancy is for Valencia.

If you are a proactive, dynamic, decisive person and, above all, you are eager to grow professionally, this is the project for you!

Come and join the Noatum Family! 

Main Functions:
Develop and manage the annual budgeting process.
Prepare detailed financial forecasts and models.
Monitor budget performance and provide variance analysis.
Conduct in-depth financial analysis to identify trends, risks, and opportunities.
Provide actionable insights and recommendations to top management.
Support strategic initiatives with financial analysis and modeling.
Identify and implement process improvements to enhance efficiency and accuracy.
Leverage technology and tools to streamline financial analysis and reporting.
Develop and maintain dashboards and KPIs for performance tracking and ensure accuracy of financial data.
 

We offer:
Stable contract
Continuous training thanks to our Corporate University.
Competitive salary based on experience.
Afternoon off on your birthday.
Excellent working environment in a multidisciplinary and multicultural environment.
At Noatum we guarantee equality and non-discrimination based on sex, race, religion, disability, age and sexual orientation in our selection processes, in order to make the best use of people's abilities in all their diversity, avoiding any type of discrimination.

Minimum Requirements

Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in finance, or related field.
Master’s degree in Finance or qualified controller analyst (CCA or equivalent) is a plus.
Minimum 5/ 6 years of experience in a similar position.
Excellent English oral and written communication skills (test will be taken).
Advanced knowledge of Excel (test will be taken).
Experience of Oracle, Power BI or equivalent systems.

Languages 

English level B2+/C1 (required).
Spanish level C1 or native.
Other Requirements

Excellent analytical skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to work collaboratively with cross- functional and international teams.

4167141057.title: Finance Analyst
4167141057.description:
About the job
WERFEN is a global leader in specialized diagnostics in the fields of hemostasis, acute care, autoimmunity, transfusion, and transplant. Our core business revolves around the research and development, manufacturing, and distribution of diagnostic innovative systems for hospitals and clinical laboratories, for the improvement of patient care.
We are a family-owned company founded in 1966 in Barcelona, Spain.
🌎 We have a direct presence in over 30 countries and distribute our products in more than 100 countries worldwide.
🩵Our Purpose: We contribute to the advancement of patient care around the world through innovative specialized diagnostics. The Patient is always at the center of our strategies, decisions, and everything we do.
🧬Our DNA: We are passionate about our work. Everything we do, we do in service to the healthcare community.
🏢 +7,000 collaborators are part of our family, JOIN US AND LET US CONTINUE GROWING TOGETHER.
 Job Summary 
We are looking for a Finance Manager to expatriate in one of the 30+ Werfen affiliates or Technology Centers, in a minimum 3-year assignment.
This position is to first have an initial onboarding program in Barcelona Headquarters for 1-2 years. During this period, the selected candidate will be appointed as Finance Analyst to receive a solid induction of Werfen and the Finance function, before moving to one of our subsidiaries worldwide as Finance Manager.
An excellent opportunity to take on a management role in a short period of time with key responsibilities within a global leader in the Diagnostics field. Which given our size and reach can offer plenty of excellent growth and development opportunities in the mid-long term.
The Finance Manager at Werfen affiliate is a key strategic role. He/She is responsible for providing financial oversight and leadership of Werfen’s businesses in the country, contributing to the results optimization through analysis, procedure implementation and risk management. He/she provides a comprehensive and highly qualified financial and business support to the General Manager and Business Areas.
The Financial Analyst at Barcelona Headquarters plays a key role in analyzing financial data and the performance of Werfen, supporting in corporate projects, supporting in corporate Closing, contributing in special projects to be assigned, among a variety of other tasks.
 Key Accountabilities - Finance Manager 
Accounting/Tax/Audit/Legal:
Oversee preparation of the Financial Statements. Prepare the corporate reporting for Headquarters on a monthly basis.
Ensure all the international standards and local requirements are followed properly.
Coordinate the day-to-day operations of the financial department and cash-flow.
Manage financial audits and produce recommendations for the improvement of procedures.
Lead the implementation of the corporate procedures in the affiliate.
Establish and maintain appropriate internal controls and safeguards.
Identify risk (taxes, accounting, etc.).
Ensure compliance of all tax regulations and optimizing taxes.
Supervise the processing of payrolls, hiring and dismissal of personnel, and management of the personnel training records.

Finance Business Partner
Provide financial and business analysis to support all activities and projects in the country and guarantee an adequate monitoring and decision-making process.
Provide constant analysis of the profitability of the business. PL by customer analysis, pricing, and margins analysis.
Give support and insights to the General Manager and Department Directors to help take commercial decisions.
Lead the preparation of financial outlooks and financials forecast for decision making.
Manage and coordinate the functions of financial planning and budget management of the company.
Monitor and analyze the monthly operational results against budget and prior year.
Propose and lead initiatives to minimize expenses and maximize profit.
Coordinate with commercial departments conditions with customers (profitability analysis, payment terms, limit of credit, pricing, discounts, etc…)
Key Networks/Relationships – Finance Manager 
Interaction with senior management.
This position requires cooperation with all the department managers of the affiliate as well as with corporate back office departments (IT, Supply Chain, Corporate Finance, Controlling, etc ) to ensure complete information and analysis.
 Key Accountabilities – Financial Analyst 
Assist in the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual consolidated financial statements.
Analyze periodic reports of actual and budget data.
Organize and present relevant financial information for effective decision-making.
Continuously improve the quality and reliability of financial information provided.
Perform detailed analysis, including expenditure analysis and cash flow assessments.
Assess the financial impact of strategic and operational actions.
Lead ad hoc financial projects as needed.
Key Networks/Relationships – Financial Analyst 
Interaction with senior management.
Interaction with finance teams around the world, including corporate finance managers and subsidiaries.
 Minimum Knowledge and experience required for the position: 
Bachelor’s and master’s degree in business administration, Finance, Accounting, or a related field.
More than 3 years of experience in M&A in a Big4 firm or in a corporate setting.
Experience in finance with multinational companies, including consolidation work, might be considered.
Extensive knowledge of advanced accounting and financial reporting concepts, principles, and practices.
Advanced knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint.
Experience with digital finance applications will be considered a plus.
Familiarity with the accounting system SAP will also be a plus.
Proficiency in written and spoken English; other language skills desired.
 Skills & Capabilities: 
M&A experience, including opportunity identification, financial analysis, due diligence, agreement negotiation, and the achievement of financial synergies.
Experience in financial modelling and analysis.
Strategic thinking.
Excellent presentation skills.
Ability to influence and persuade.
Excellent time management and organizational skills.
Ability to multitask and meet deadlines.
Exceptional problem-solving skills.
Mastery of logical reasoning.
Above average communication skills.
Ability to work in teams and collaborate with diverse groups of people.
Travel Requirements: 
Limited short-term travel.
Mandatory medium to long term international mobility
WERFEN is a global leader in specialized diagnostics in the fields of hemostasis, acute care, autoimmunity, transfusion, and transplant. Our core business revolves around the research and development, manufacturing, and distribution of diagnostic innovative systems for hospitals and clinical laboratories, for the improvement of patient care.
WERFEN
We are a family-owned company founded in 1966 in Barcelona, Spain.
🌎 We have a direct presence in over 30 countries and distribute our products in more than 100 countries worldwide.
🩵Our Purpose: We contribute to the advancement of patient care around the world through innovative specialized diagnostics. The Patient is always at the center of our strategies, decisions, and everything we do.
🧬Our DNA: We are passionate about our work. Everything we do, we do in service to the healthcare community.
🏢 +7,000 collaborators are part of our family, JOIN US AND LET US CONTINUE GROWING TOGETHER.
JOIN US AND LET US CONTINUE GROWING TOGETHER.

4162735637.title: Junior Finance Analyst - 6 Month Contract
4162735637.description:
About the job
Please Note: If you are a current Spin Master employee with access to Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.

Are you a kid at heart looking to build a career with a leading global children's toy, entertainment and digital gaming company?

At Spin Master, our unwavering commitment to open mindedness, integrity and innovation is a great part of what has made us an industry leader. How do we stay ahead of the pack? By hiring the best and brightest minds—and that’s why we want you!

Job Description

Please note this is a 6-month contractor position.

Spin Master is a leading global children's entertainment company, creating exceptional play experiences through it’s three creative centres: Toys, Entertainment and Digital Games. With distribution in over 100 countries, Spin Master is best known for award-winning brands PAW Patrol®, Bakugan®, Kinetic Sand®, Air Hogs®, Hatchimals®, Rubik’s Cube® and GUND®, and is the global toy licensee for other popular properties.

What will you work on? 

The Junior Finance Analyst assists in ensuring that reporting is accurate and timely, along with managing the statutory and accounting processes for Spin Master.

They will be a key contributor to the monthly and annual management reporting, forecast planning processes, working with the businesses unit leaders to enable an understanding of local financial performance and developing consistent, concise forecasts and plans, and monthly variance reporting at a cost centre level.

How will you create impact? 

Month end journal preparation for general ledger (excluding accounts receivable, accounts payable and intercompany entries) for Spain
Prepare the monthly management accounts and prepare and review analysis files to ensure the accuracy and integrity of the financial and management reporting;
Review month end PL market reporting and sales reports to be supplied to the sales team and management team;
Review the month end reports (GA overhead focus) and comment on performance against objectives;
Prepare account reconciliations for Spanish entity on a monthly basis, and review with the Finance Manager;
Preparation of Statutory Accounts and compliance with local GAAP;
Liaise with external tax advisors and auditors in regards to the Spanish annual statutory requirements

How will you fit into the team? 

The Junior Financial Analyst reports to Manager, Finance Iberia.

What are your skills and experience? 

A Bachelor’s degree in Accounting / Finance or other related area
A minimum of 1-2 years related experience in a mid to large sized company
Understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and IFRS
Knowledge of Spanish accounting plan-PGC and principles is a must
Knowledge of Portuguese accounting plan and principles is an advantage
Experience with Consumer Goods/ Retail Industry preferred
Strong MS Excel skills
SAP experience
Strong organisational skills and attention to detail
Ability to multi-task and work in a challenging fast paced environment
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills
Maturity, professionalism, and high level of discretion are required
Strong work ethic with a positive, can-do attitude
Fluent in English, Verbal and written

#SpinMaster #Valencia #Spain #Finance #Toys 

What You Can Expect From Us

Our mission is to Make Life More Fun with a vision to push the boundaries of innovation, creativity, and fun.

Growth and Career Opportunities
Flexible Work Hours
Innovation, Collaboration and Fun
Comprehensive Benefits
Other fun Perks!

What’s it like to work here?

Spin Master is a fast-paced, hands-on organization that provides many great opportunities for impactful decision-making; though our challenging start-up atmosphere isn’t for everyone, we have a proven record of opportunities for future advancement and internal transfers for our passionate and results driven team.

Everyone is welcome in our sandbox and we are committed to an accessible and inclusive hiring process that provides reasonable accommodation to all applicants.

Spin Master strives to create an accessible and inclusive application and selection process and is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to job applicants who may require provisions to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment processes. Should you require an accommodation, please contact our Talent Acquisition team, by email at JobsEU@spinmaster.com and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

We do appreciate all interest; however only those selected for interview will be contacted.

4170802367.title: FP&A Analyst
4170802367.description:
About the job
We are looking for a Senior FP&A Analyst to join theFP&A department. You will be providing business partnering support to the global marketing and operations (sales & Customer care) teams, and also analytical support to the global finance director. This is a high profile role with direct access to key members of the senior management team.

About the Role - Main responsibilities and functions
Providing management with analysis and insight into the marketing and operations department’s performance across 3 brands of the group.
Budget preparations and latest estimate forecasting for Marketing and Operations of 3 brands of the group.
Monthly P&L preparation and analysis in conjunction with collaborating with the marketing and operations teams to gain insight and information on performance.
Very detailed cost control of Staff costs. Actual reconciliations by FTE compared to Budget/estimations, and their correct allocation by department, entity and market.
Monthly accruals and allocations by marketing, entity, brand and in local currencies.
Building strong relationships within your stakeholders.
FP&A support by means of sales analysis and adhoc modelling.
Adding value to decision making by providing recommendations.
Ad hoc analysis as requested and by own initiative.

 Qualifications - Qualifications and experience
Prior 3 years experience in budgeting and forecasting and cost controlling.
Experience in Staff costs control and Marketing business partnering highly desired.
Proven ability in bringing numbers to life for non-Finance stakeholders.
Proven ability to work with high level of data and advanced level of Excel.

 Required Skills
Strong customer service ethos and high attention to detail.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal).
Used to work under pressure in a changing and dynamic scenarios.
High level of initiative, self-motivation and drive.
Strong technical accounting skills and an analytical and process-focused mind.
Ability to prioritise, plan, manage time efficiently and meet deadlines.
Quick to pick up and apply knowledge.
Fluent English and Spanish compulsory.


Preferred Skills
Pay range and compensation package - Contract: Permanent contract Activity rate : 100% 
Salary: Gross salary + cheque gourmet card + bonus Place of work: Barcelona, Spain

Additional information - What we offer you
Creative and rewarding work.
Ticket restaurant.
Discount on private medical insurance.
Half day off on your birthday.
Unlimited tea & coffee.
Free breakfast on Mondays, Free Fruits on Thursdays!
A stimulating and dynamic work environment.
Free languages courses abroad.

4138066125.title: Middle Office Analyst
4138066125.description:
About the job
Location : Barcelona

City : Sant Just Desvern

State : Barcelona (ES-B)

Country : Spain (ES)

BUNGE has an exciting opportunity available for a Middle Office Analyst. In this role, you will be provide on the daily basis support to the Commercial team on the operational side including financial and position back up, translation of the trading activities into a daily position and PL report. Serve as a central point of contact for trading operation tasks supporting trade flow verifications and accuracy of each transaction as well as ensure consistency and completeness of the data flow across all other involved departments and systems. Additionally drive for automation and efficiency improvements to the current reporting processes and tools.

“Since 1818, Bunge has been connecting farmers to consumers to deliver essential food, feed, and fuel to the world. Looking to the future, our ambition is to continuously reinvent ourselves, leveraging data to be at the forefront of analytics, technology and talent to accomplish our purpose in a better, faster and simpler way. Bunge is committed to operating and thriving in the digital world – creating world class agile teams where teammates are empowered and encouraged to collaborate and test and learn to succeed.”

Note: you are ideally located in Barcelona to obtain this job.

Some responsibilities of the Middle Office Analyst are:

Trade Administration / Trade Support ( Daily Positions & P&L )

 Producing accurate and reliable daily VC Commodity Positions & PL report:
 Cash/flat activities/trades – new trades updated/reconciled with commercial team. 
 Freight position (+MTM) – reconciled against freight department/commercial team. 
 Co-ordinate with trading/execution/logistic teams on vessel execution – and reflect impacts in Daily PL. 
 Pricing monitoring/confirmation to contracts/execution/traders including tracking changes for accuracy across all systems. 
 Reconcile and publish the Daily Position & PL. 
 Send trade slip to contract admin in case I/Co sales out of Geneva. 
 Interoffice futures transfers in case of I/Co sales out of Geneva. 
 Consolidate, transform and analyze data from multiple sources to meet reporting requirements.
 Prepare and explain daily P&L changes, including analysis on the main drives of the daily result.
 Provide information, assistance and analysis to the commercial team.
 Optimize Excel-based reports to reduce rote tasks, minimize human error and improve production speed.
 Ad hoc reports & projects and other duties as requested.

Pre-Load Execution

 Provide, monitor and check with traders/operations/contracts consistency of any operations/ contractual changes (cross checking impact).

Extra Costs / Bad Debt

 Review accruals reports, extra costs and Bad Debts reports.
 Follow up and align with commercial owners and finance departments to understand the drivers/impacts of the financial PL / reconciliation.

Closing the books

 Collect, review and confirm month end inputs required for the closing: prices, freight rates, base locations, volumes etc.
 Reconciliation of monthly results with Accounting (MTM, prices, execution, extra costs etc).
 Liase across functions to identify and resolve gaps during month end closing process.

Results analysis

 Margin analysis – identify main buckets of the margin structure/drivers:
 Understand and explain drivers of structural component of the margin. 
 Understand and explain trading component of the margin. 

We are looking for different skills / experience:

 University degree in accounting, finance, economics or related field level.
 Minimum 3 years of experience in accounting, finance or control preferably in the commodity trading industry.
 Good knowledge of SAP.
 Fluent English – other language an asset.
 High proficient Excel skills.
 Ability to deal with complex problems involving non-standardized situations.

Strong analytical skills and business acumen - good understanding of commodity trading and mark to market is a plus.

 Ability to work in a team/independently and to prioritize and handle multiple tasks.
 Meticulous attention to details.
 Strong interpersonal skills.

At Bunge, people don’t just come here to work, they come here to grow – solving challenges that directly impact the world with a diverse team of thinkers and doers.

If this description reflects your profile or ambition, we’re looking forward to seeing your application and motivation in English by hitting apply!

In case of questions, please reach out to Aitor Alonso (Talent Acquisition Specialist at aitor.alonso@bunge.com).

Acquisition by agencies is not appreciated, we do not use agencies at this moment for our recruitment. Open proposals of candidates are at own risk.

We Are Bunge

Bunge is a global agribusiness with one mission – we connect farmers to consumers to deliver essential food, feed and fuel to the world. We have unmatched global scale and deeply rooted relationships which allow us to bring innovative ingredients and knowledge to some of the world’s biggest brands – many of which are likely in your home right now.

We know that to achieve our mission and deliver the best results to our customers, each other and the world we need to work together – so we hire talented people who are passionate, bold and driven to work as One Bunge. This dedication is deeply embedded in our culture and reflected in the way we work.

Every day our people exemplify these values, which represent Bunge at its core:

 Act as One Team 

by fostering inclusion,

collaboration and respect.

 Drive for Excellence 

by being agile innovative and efficient.

Do What’s Right

by acting safely, ethically and sustainably.

If this sounds like you, join us! We value and invest in people who believe in our purpose and are excited to live it every day – people who are #ProudtoBeBunge.

Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status.
