4173581087.title: Investment Analyst - M&A, Mobile Apps
4173581087.description:
About the job
Investment Analyst - M&A, B2C, Mobile
First things first, if you are looking for a fully remote role with flexible hours, unlimited time off, and are based somewhere in Europe or Asia, read on. 🌍

This role is not just a job; it's a calling for those who dare to lead, inspire, and transform the digital landscape. Join us, and let's chart the course to a future written in the stars of success.

About BlueThrone
Embark on a transformative journey with BlueThrone, a pioneer in the mobile app domain.
Our Specialization: Turning promising Indie Mobile apps into market leaders, boasting over 50 million downloads and 5 million monthly active users.
Our Mission: Propel iOS and Android applications to new heights. We've achieved a remarkable $10 ARR organically in just 30 months, exemplifying sustainable growth and innovation.
Our Team: Rich in tech entrepreneurship and mobile marketing expertise, we thrive in an environment that values agility, growth mindset, flexibility, creativity, and tangible outcomes.
At BlueThrone, your career is more than a job—it's a journey towards excellence in an innovative culture where high performance is as valued as innovation.

The Role
BlueThrone is seeking a talented Investment Analyst to join our team and drive strategic decisions on app acquisitions and performance management. This role is perfect for someone who thrives in a high-growth, fast-paced environment and is passionate about using financial and market data to make impactful decisions.
You’ll love it here if:
• You prefer flexible hours, unlimited time off, and the freedom to work from anywhere.🌍
• You’re naturally curious, detail-oriented, and motivated by impactful data analysis.
• You enjoy wearing multiple hats and adapting to the needs of a growing company.
• You value a calm, focused, and results-oriented work environment.
• You’re driven to work smarter, not harder, prioritizing productivity over busy work.
• You love what you do and are ready to roll up your sleeves to contribute to a transformative mission.
Above all, you follow your passion and have fun while doing it.
What are we looking for? 🔎
The ideal candidate will have a strong background in investment analysis, valuation modeling, financial due diligence, and strategic financial planning within the mobile or B2C space. This role requires a strategic thinker who can assess the potential and profitability of mobile apps, support acquisition decisions, analyze ongoing performance, and provide insightful recommendations for business growth.


Your Mission
• Investment Analysis: Conduct thorough financial and strategic analysis of potential app acquisitions, including evaluating revenue potential, growth opportunities, and competitive positioning.
• Valuation & Financial Modeling: Develop and maintain robust valuation and financial models from scratch, focusing on forecasting and financial planning to assess app worth, taking into account revenue sources like in-app purchases, ads, and subscriptions.
• Financial Due Diligence & Revenue Analysis: Execute due diligence on potential acquisitions, analyzing historical financials, operational metrics, and revenue drivers such as in-app purchases, in-app ads, and subscriptions to support business decisions.
• Market Research & Competitive Analysis: Perform market and competitive analysis to understand trends, risks, and growth opportunities within the mobile app industry.
• Portfolio & Performance Analysis: Monitor the performance of acquired apps, track KPIs post-acquisition, and analyze key financial and operational metrics, providing insights and recommendations to maximize return on investment.
• Collaboration & Business Partnership: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product, finance, and growth teams, to gather relevant data for financial analysis and contribute to acquisition strategies.
• Stakeholder Reporting: Prepare and present detailed investment and performance reports to senior management, including the Board, founders, CEO, COO, and CFO, ensuring they are well-informed on both potential and existing investments.



Your Expedition Toolkit
• Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, or related field; CFA, CAIA, or CPA preferred.
• Experience: 5-8 years of experience in investment analysis, financial planning, or valuation, ideally within B2C mobile, gaming, or tech industries.
• Valuation & Model-Building Skills: Proven experience building detailed financial and valuation models from the ground up, with a strong understanding of bottom-up financial modeling techniques.
• Revenue Knowledge: Deep understanding of revenue sources and financial metrics for mobile apps, particularly in-app purchases, in-app ads, and subscriptions.
• Strategic Insight: Ability to provide strategic insights that support business growth, operational efficiency, and data-driven decision-making.
• Analytical Skills: Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data, identify trends, and make strategic recommendations.
• Communication & Collaboration: Strong communication skills with a track record of working effectively with cross-functional teams and presenting complex data in a clear, concise manner.
• Technical Proficiency: Proficient in financial software, advanced Excel skills, and familiarity with Notion or similar tools for tracking and reporting.
 




The Interview Process 🪜
First Meeting: Connect with our people team for a mutual introduction and to see if we're a good fit (30 minutes).
Second Meeting: Meet our COO & Co-funder to discuss your background and experience (45 minutes).
Challenge: Demonstrate your abilities with a focus on Financial Modeling (1 hour).
Third Meeting: Meet our CEO to discuss your insights from the challenge.
On average, our process takes about 3-4 weeks. Speed is as important to us as it is to you. 💨
Equal opportunities for everyone 💖
To truly represent our vibrant and diverse BlueThrone community, we prioritize diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone can do their best work. We strongly encourage applicants of all backgrounds. We consider all candidates regardless of age, ethnicity, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran status, neurodiversity, or disability. If you need reasonable adjustments at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

4133034119.title: Associate, Capital Formation (Data Analytics & Reporting)
4133034119.description:
About the job
Permira is a global private equity investment firm. The firm was established in 1985 and has made over 300 private equity investments since its inception. The first pan-European private equity fund was raised in 1997, investing out of four offices in Frankfurt, London, Milan and Paris. Since then, Permira has grown steadily and today is present on three continents across 16 offices. An international team of investment professionals cover a wide range of backgrounds and experiences. At present, the firm's teams advise funds with total committed capital of approximately €80 billion. Permira funds have consistently outperformed the market over the past 20 years, delivering strong returns across economic cycles. Permira’s core focus is on multinational companies with international growth potential across four sectors: Tech, Consumer, Services and Healthcare.

Permira Credit is one of Europe’s leading specialist debt management businesses comprising three core strategies: Direct Lending, CLO Management and Strategic Opportunities. Since inception in 2007, our funds have provided over €20bn+ of capital to over 300+ European businesses. Permira Credit has supported companies across diverse industries but is mainly focused on companies active in business services, technology, and healthcare. Permira Credit is owned by Permira and currently has 85+ employees mainly based in London. Over the next four years, Permira Credit is planning to grow its credit assets under management to € 25bn.

The successful candidate will be an important member of Permira’s Capital Formation team, which is responsible for both raising new capital and for maintaining strong relationships with our existing investors. We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented professional with a strong focus on data management, reporting and analytics.

Key Responsibilities 

Data Analytics & Insights 
Support with gathering, analysing and presenting financial data and insights for internal and external reporting purposes
Working closely with investment teams to continuously assess templates, processes and systems used for data collection and identify areas for improvement
Preparing investor presentations, reports ensuring alignment with key corporate messages and strategic objectives
Data Integrity & Compliance
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and consistency across all reports and investor materials
Ensure compliance with securities regulations, company policies, and best practices in investor communications
Investor Reporting
Designing reports that provide visualizations and business intelligence capabilities
Collaborate with investment teams to establish the collection of performance data and key metrics
Liaising with fund administrators, finance and legal to ensure consistency and transparency in reporting
Provide support during investor meetings, including preparing presentation materials, Q&A responses and follow-up reports
Process Improvement & Innovation
Identify opportunities to streamline reporting processes, enhance data visualization, and leverage new tools and technologies for improved efficiencies and effectiveness
Desired Experience / Background

2-3 years’ experience in Investment Banking, Management Consulting, Investor Relations or a related field
Strong academic performance, degree in Finance, Accounting, Business or related field
Experience with financial modelling, valuation analysis, and data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI)
Strong analytical and quantitative skills with a deep understanding of financial metrics
Excellent written and verbal communication skills - fluent written and spoken English, other languages advantageous
Microsoft Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint to an advanced level.
Effective planning and organisation skills; ability to prioritise tasks and deliver to deadlines
High level of motivation, integrity, energy and enthusiasm

4167169733.title: Pricing Analyst
4167169733.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Analista de Pricing Grupo FireSobre Grupo Fire:Grupo Fire es un líder destacado en la industria de protección contra incendios en España, contando con más de 300 profesionales, una base de clientes que supera los 50,000, y operaciones en seis regiones.

Conocidos por nuestro compromiso con la seguridad y la calidad, estamos en constante expansión y evolución para satisfacer las necesidades de nuestros clientes y del mercado.Estamos creciendo y en 2025 seremos la principal compañía de protección contra incendios en España.Descripción del Puesto:Buscamos un Analista de Pricing Estratégico que se especialice en la utilización de grandes bases de datos de clientes para identificar patrones de precios y oportunidades de optimización.

Este rol es clave para maximizar la rentabilidad y retención de clientes mediante ajustes estratégicos en la estructura de precios.Responsabilidades Clave:Analizar extensas bases de datos de clientes para identificar patrones y tendencias en precios por tipo de cliente, servicio, área geográfica y tamaño de cliente.Desarrollar modelos predictivos para determinar oportunidades de incremento de precios y evaluar el impacto potencial en la retención y rentabilidad.Trabajar en conjunto con los equipos de operaciones y comerciales para implementar aumentos de precios y asegurar su aceptación en el mercado.Monitorizar y evaluar el impacto de los ajustes de precios en la retención de clientes y la rentabilidad global de la empresa.Realizar seguimiento continuo y análisis de la correlación entre incrementos de precios y cambios en la dinámica del mercado y comportamiento del cliente.Calificaciones:Título universitario en Economía, Finanzas, Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería Industrial o campo relacionado.Al menos 3-5 años de experiencia en análisis de datos o roles analíticos financieros, con un fuerte enfoque en análisis de bases de datos grandes.Experiencia específica en roles de pricing, incluyendo el desarrollo de estrategias de precios y evaluación de su efectividad.Experiencia en modelado de datos, análisis predictivo y herramientas analíticas avanzadas.Competencia comprobada para trabajar con datos complejos y realizar análisis cuantitativos detallados.Excelentes habilidades comunicativas, con fluidez en español e inglés.Lo Que Ofrecemos:Salario competitivo con compensación variable basada en el rendimiento.Oportunidades de crecimiento acelerado en una empresa que está expandiendo su tamaño anualmente.Un ambiente colaborativo con un equipo de alto calibre.Formación continua y oportunidades de desarrollo profesional.Proceso de Aplicación:Los candidatos interesados deben enviar su currículum y una carta de presentación explicando sus calificaciones e interés en el puesto a ******ón: Barcelona o Madrid, EspañaTipo de Contrato: Tiempo completo, IndefinidoFecha de Inicio: Inmediata

4056159598.title: Financial Analyst Internship (m/f/d)
4056159598.description:
About the job
MISSION: Support the Finance Analysis and Project Structures in the Wind Sector

Tasks

Support Sales department in financial topics regarding projects.
Support in creating financial analysis and reports.
Conduction of market and competition analysis.
Support in creating budget and forecast plans.
Assistance in creating presentations for management.
Project valuation: analysis of project cash flows, margins, achieved vs. expected results.

Your Profile

4176446725.title: Finance Analyst Intern
4176446725.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
En Impulsa CFO, apoyamos a Corporates, Startups, Fondos de VC/PE y PYMES con soluciones financieras estratégicas y operativas.

Si te interesan las finanzas y quieres aprender trabajando con empresas reales, buscamos un Finance Analyst Intern para incorporarse a nuestro equipo.

¿Qué harás?

Apoyar en el análisis financiero y la construcción de modelos en Excel.Colaborar en la preparación de reportes financieros y métricas clave para clientes.Dar soporte en procesos operativos y estratégicos en diferentes industrias.Participar en el seguimiento de inversiones y la preparación de información para fondos y startups.Ayudar en tareas contables y de control financiero según necesidades de los clientes. ¿Qué buscamos en ti?

Estudiante o recién graduado en ADE, Economía, Finanzas o carreras afines.Excel avanzado, incluyendo modelización financiera.Mentalidad analítica, autonomía y ganas de aprender.Inglés es un plus. ¿Qué ofrecemos?

Prácticas remuneradas con flexibilidad entre 20 y 35 horas semanales.Posibilidad de contratación al finalizar las prácticas.Aprendizaje en un entorno dinámico con clientes de distintos sectores.Oportunidad de trabajar en proyectos de alto impacto en el ecosistema financiero. ¿Te interesa?

Envíanos tu CV a ****** con el asunto: Finance Analyst Intern – [Tu Nombre]

4151620358.title: Analyst M&A Financial Institutions Iberia
4151620358.description:
About the job
GROUP BNP PARIBAS

BNP Paribas Group is the top bank in the European Union and a major international banking establishment. It has close to 185,000 employees in 65 countries. In Spain we are more than 5,100 employees within 13 business lines.

CIB

BNP Paribas Corporate & Institutional Banking provides large companies, multinationals and financial institutions with various solutions in the areas of advisory, financing, transactional banking, capital markets, settlement, clearing and custody of securities, asset and fund management services and solutions for corporate issuers. It has 620 professionals in Spain with offices in Madrid, Barcelona, Bilbao and Coruña. The entity has a network present in 56 countries.

Overall Responsibilities

Opportunity to be part of a leading advisory team, assisting clients, primarily Iberian Financial Institutions (i.e. banks, insurance, asset managers, fintechs) in defining their long-term strategy and inorganic growth plans with views to maximising value for its key stakeholders 
Be part of the team leading landmark transactions that have an impact in the future of Spanish and Portuguese financial sector 
The work in FIC Advisory The r includes two main type of tasks: (i) marketing materials, in which the team proactively presents ideas to the client, and (ii) executions, where the team advises clients in strategic transactions, which comprise sellsides, buysides, IPOs, take private, partnerships, etc. 
An analyst’s responsibility is to support the team (MD / Director / VP / Associate) in both workstreams and its specific responsibilities are:
Conduct market and sector research and companies research
Understand and analyse the financial information of financial institutions
Analyse diligently and with good judgement the information and present it in a clear and concise manner 
Prepare thoughtful presentations for clients 
Conduct financial analysis, including business projections, valuation models 
Take responsibility for the tasks delegated by VP / Associate
Deliver best-in-class materials in a competitive industry requiring the highest standards for clients 
Marketing materials

Prepare client presentations autonomously on the basis of guidelines and supervision of the Associate, VP, Director and Managing Director
Preparation of a presentation includes (i) conducting the required research, (ii) analysing the information, (iii) preparing financial analysis, (iv) selecting the relevant information and prepare slides in a concise and self-explanatory manner, (v) reviewing the presentation with the Associate and Managing Director
Preparation of follow ups for the client in a timely manner
Appropriate exposure to clients when possible under direct supervision of Managing Director

Transaction Execution

Assist Managing Director / Associate in key steps of an execution. Executions include: sellside, buyside, take private, fairness opinions, IPOs for instance
Prepare models autonomously (trading/ transaction multiples, Business Plan and DDM) or under supervision of Associate for more complex analyses (LBO, Merger Model) 
Prepare presentations for clients in its decision making process for Top Management, Executive Committees, Board Members 
Prepare sell side materials (descriptive sections of Information Memorandum, data rooms, drafting of management presentation), buyside materials, IPO materials, valuation materials, fairness opinions, etc 

Presentation & communication

Excellent communication skills, both orally and written, and presentation skills 
Present and explain clearly results of research & analyses to Associate / MD
Ability to communicate in a concise and summarised manner, giving the relevant information

Modelling and technical skills

Prepare financial and valuation models for marketing purposes and executions
Excel in modelling skills, analytical and numerical tasks, including accounting, financial and valuation techniques

Team responsibilities

Contribute to recruitment and training of interns 
Ability to collaborate and work in team

Essential

Profile

Demonstrate strong interest in Corporate Finance, mergers & acquisitions and understand key responsibilities/tasks of the job
Strong interest in financial institutions resulting in being up to date on the sector, macro economy, mergers and acquisitions, general sector knowledge
Proactive approach, eagerness to learn, inquisitive and questions the status quo
Take accountability and ownership of its own responsibilities
Works independently and with autonomy. Problem solver 
Excellent organisational skills, with strong ability to multi-task
Capability to work under tight deadlines, excellent time management and prioritisation
Demonstrate rigour and reliability for her / his own work 
Team spirit, collaborative and inclusive way of working
High standard performance in a competitive industry advising key clients in very visible and important transactions

Technical competencies

Excellent knowledge of accounting, financial and valuation techniques
Strong numerical and analytical ability, aptitude to think strategically
Numerical and analytical skills with strong modelling skills (DDM, multiples, basic LBO model, basic merger model and value creation analyses…)
Knowledge of process and key steps for major types of transactions (sell side, buy side, LBO, public offer, IPO)

Other Important Competencies

Strong academic background, Master Degree in Finance, Management, Economics, Engineering area/s
Current or past experience in working in Corporate Finance and in particular in Financial Institutions Corporate
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Fluency in English is compulsory, any European languages a plus 
At ease with Microsoft Office tools, FactSet, Bloomberg and other information database

Benefits

 Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.
 Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).
 Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.
 Flexible compensation plan.
 31 vacation days.

Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.
GROUP BNP PARIBAS

4168169630.title: Corporate Financial Modeller
4168169630.description:
About the job
R0001192 Corporate Financial Modeller (Open)

We’re Nadara. We work harmoniously with the power of nature and the communities around us to power lifetimes to come. We call our approach ‘living energy’.

We don’t just produce renewable energy, we live it – recognising our relationship with the people touched by our business and supporting social, educational, cultural, and environmental initiatives that contribute to the development of the communities we work alongside.

Discover more about our business here: https://nadara.com/about/

Nadara is an innovative place to work. We work in a stimulating and challenging environment, where every day we explore the unknown with curiosity, make decisions with quality and take action and deliver with courage. For us diversity is a real value, and we encourage in connecting different perspectives with respect.

Discover more about our culture and approach here: https://nadara.com/living-the-company/

Job Description Summary

We are a rapidly growing and dynamic organization and, as part of our expansion, our NAV & Valuation team in the CFO department is seeking a Corporate Financial Modeller. This role offers an exciting opportunity to thrive in an international and fast-paced environment, where challenges and growth opportunities abound.

The Corporate Financial Modeller will be supporting quarterly Group evaluations, valuations of third-party companies, specific assets, and strategic initiatives.

A key focus will be maintaining and enhancing the existing Group Financial Model.

Job Description

Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain complex financial models for various purposes, including:
Net Asset Value (NAV) reporting – ensuring accurate valuation and financial insights for reporting purposes.
Project financing – structuring models to assess financial feasibility, funding requirements, and risk analysis.
M&A transactions – evaluating acquisition targets, synergy potential, and deal structuring.
Development projects – assessing investment returns, cash flow projections, and funding structures.
Impairment testing – analyzing asset valuations to determine potential impairments in line with accounting standards.
Conduct detailed sensitivity analyses to evaluate financial risks and support decision-making.
Provide daily support for all activities related to quarterly Group valuations.
Assist in the preparation and presentation of strategic reports for shareholders.
Support the development, review, and refinement of third-party financial models for bids, investments, and transactions as required.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Growth, Energy Markets, Planning & Control, and Structured Finance, to ensure consistency and alignment in financial evaluations.
Key Requirements

Fluent in English (Italian and Spanish are a plus).
A university degree in Economics or Engineering.
3–4 years of professional experience, preferably in the renewable energy or infrastructure sectors.
Advanced Excel skills with a focus on financial modeling for infrastructure-related businesses.
A proactive, detail-oriented, and team-focused approach.
Problem-solving abilities paired with a creative and analytical mindset.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

Location

The position is open in several key locations, preferable in Milan / London, or Madrid.

Pay And Benefits

With a genuine culture of reward and recognition, we want our employees to grow, develop and be part of our journey. We offer a benefits package that includes flexible working policy, development and training opportunities, a wide range of initiatives dedicated to wellbeing and mental health. There’s no doubt that you will be compensated for your hard work and commitment so if you’d like to work for one of the top Renewable Energy providers in the world then please do get in touch with us!

Equality and equity

Our company is an Equal Opportunities Employer with a strong commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusivity (DEI). DEI provides an anchor for our long-term business strategy and permeates through our day-to-day culture, ensuring people of all backgrounds can thrive.

We hire based on merit, competence, and qualifications, with salary determined on a case-by-case basis, taking into consideration job-related knowledge and skills, education, and experience.

We’ll achieve our vision through the energy and expertise of talented people like you. Join us and help secure the future of people and the planet!

What We Offer

At our organization, we empower our people to make an impact, think creatively, and tackle challenges while identifying new opportunities. This position offers exceptional career development prospects within an innovative and youthful company.

What We Expect From You

We are looking for individuals with passion, dedication, and a commitment to learning from every task and challenge. As a valued member of our team, you will play a key role in driving growth and success for our business.

Location:

Milano - Martesana

Time Type

Full time

Worker Subtype

Regular
We’re Nadara. We work harmoniously with the power of nature and the communities around us to power lifetimes to come. We call our approach ‘living energy’.
We don’t just produce renewable energy, we live it – recognising our relationship with the people touched by our business and supporting social, educational, cultural, and environmental initiatives that contribute to the development of the communities we work alongside.
Discover more about our business here: https://nadara.com/about/
Nadara is an innovative place to work. We work in a stimulating and challenging environment, where every day we explore the unknown with curiosity, make decisions with quality and take action and deliver with courage. For us diversity is a real value, and we encourage in connecting different perspectives with respect.
Discover more about our culture and approach here: https://nadara.com/living-the-company/

4178658978.title: Financial Crime Compliance Programme Analyst
4178658978.description:
About the job
Ebury is a leading global fintech company that empowers businesses to trade and grow internationally. It offers a comprehensive suite of products, including international payments and collections, FX risk management, trade finance, and API integrations. Founded in 2009 by Juan Lobato and Salvador García, Ebury is one of the fastest-growing global fintechs, with over 1,700 employees and 38 offices in more than 25 countries.

Financial Crime Compliance Programme Analyst

Location: Ebury Malaga Office - 4 days a week, 1 day from home 

Ebury is seeking an efficient, detail oriented Financial Crime Compliance (FCC) Programme Analyst to join our Compliance Operations team, to support various projects and ongoing initiatives. The programme analyst has an eagle eye for detail, a drive for efficiency and great time management skills. Their duties will consist of tracking the status of tasks within multiple projects and ongoing initiatives, administrative tasks, liaising with responsible owners for updates and ensuring that the projects and deliverables meet company goals and standards.

Objectives And Responsibilities Of This Role

Monitor every step of a project, programme or initiative for successful and timely completion
Track the status of each action in detail
Maintain various trackers relating to key compliance activities
Support the FCC Senior Programme Coordinator in the planning of new projects
Prepare meeting packs for various meetings and prepare minutes
Create and continuously improve programme reporting
Identify weak areas, best practices and (in)efficient procedures to improve future programs
Maintain consistent communication with task owners
Support in daily administrative activities

Skills And Qualifications (must Have)

Demonstrated experience in tracking and administrative activities
Attention to detail
Proven organisational skills, drive to work in a structured way
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to prioritise and complete tasks in a timely manner
Firm understanding of procedures that increase efficiency
Knowledge of Google Sheets, Docs and Slides
Dedication to fostering a collaborative team
Solution-oriented mindset
C1 English

Preferred Qualifications (nice To Have)

Experience in planning projects
Familiarity with Financial Crime Compliance (FCC), Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Counter Terrorist Financing (CTF)
Ability to generate analytical reports to measure programme impact
Familiarity with Jira

About Us

Ebury is a FinTech success story, positioned among the fastest-growing international companies in its sector.

Founded in 2009, we are headquartered in London and have more than 1700 staff with a presence in more than 25 countries worldwide. Cultural diversity is part of what makes Ebury a special place to be. From Sao Paulo to Dubai, Bucharest to Toronto, we enjoy sharing team experiences and celebrating success across the Ebury family.

Hard work pays off: in 2019, Ebury received a £350 million investment from Banco Santander and has won internationally recognised awards including Financial Times: 1000 Europe's Fastest-Growing Companies.

None of this would have been possible without our proudest achievement: our great people. Enthusiastic, innovative and collaborative teams, always ready to disrupt and revolutionise the fast-paced FinTech sector.

We believe in inclusion. We stand against discrimination in all forms and have no tolerance for the intolerance of differences that makes us a modern and successful organisation. At Ebury, you can be whoever you want to be and still feel a sense of belonging no matter your story because we want you and your uniqueness to help write our future.

Please submit your application on the careers website directly, uploading your CV / resume in English.

4153153369.title: Portfolio Retail Credit Risk Sr. Analyst
4153153369.location: Boadilla del Monte, Community of Madrid, Spain
4153153369.description:
About the job
Country: Spain

As a Portfolio Retail Credit Risk Sr. Analyst, your responsibilities will be:

Retail Risk management enhancement of Local Units in Consumer Lending products. 
Provide support Credit Risk management transformation in all aspects around Consumer Lending, admission (new Data and Decision Models and Channels), customer management, and portfolio strategy growth. 
Participation in Global Projects with particular focus on Consumer Lending: decision model developments, innovation channels, new products, global agreements, portfolio sales, and acquisition. 
Acting as a Consumer Lending Risk counterpart in HQ, coordinating with Commercial HQ / CRM / Finance, etc., when apply. 
Prepare Retail Risk Forum Material including relevant issues for escalation with particular focus on Unsecured Financing products. 
Monitoring the Local execution of the credit risk management according to corporate criteria, operational models, and risk management. 
Perform Unit analysis and management integration with budgets/targets. 
Identify strengths and weaknesses of units' capacities in his scope for retail portfolios management. 
Coordinate Corporate Policies implementation with particular focus on Unsecured Financing products 
Increase predictability and transparency of the Credit Risk Portfolios

Experience

+4 years of experience in Retail Risk management, with strong experience in Consumer Finance with focusing on Unsecured Financing products (Cash Loan, Sales finance, Invoicing, and Revolving). 
Proven experience in Scorecards, Decision Models/Strategies, and decision processes for Consumer Financing products through different channels: Branches, Brokers, digital lending, On-line Sales platforms, Portals, Banks’ cooperations, etc.)
Deep knowledge and understanding of risks metrics regarding Retail products (including but not limited to: Data sources, Scorecards, Admission Process, Portfolio management, Provision, Budget, etc.) with particular focus on Unsecured Financing products (Cash Loan, Sales finance, Invoicing, and Revolving)
Good capacity for planning and managing priorities. 
Good management skills to deal with HQ team and Local counterparties
Ability to build good executive presentations
Accounting fundamentals

EDUCATION

Bachelor of Economics / Statistics / Mathematics / Sciences / Engineering required. 
Master, Postgraduate is desired. 

Skills & Knowledge

Advanced level of Office Package required. 
Native/Advanced level of English and Spanish level is required. 

Other Information

Availability to travel is desired. 

If you want to know more about us, follow us on https://es.linkedin.com/company/banco-santander

4173627050.title: Analista de mercados financieros
4173627050.description:
About the job
Sotec selecciona un Analista de Markets y Datos financieros en Madrid, en modalidad híbrida, para una importante empresa del sector financiero.
Buscamos un perfil con experiencia en:
· Gestión y análisis de grandes volúmenes de datos relacionados con productos de Markets (derivados, bonos, estructurados, etc.).
· Manejo ágil de Excel (formulación, tablas dinámicas, vínculos entre hojas) y, valorable, conocimientos de SQL.
· Conocimientos contables aplicados al análisis financiero.
· Nivel de inglés mínimo B2.
¿Qué esperamos de ti?
· Experiencia en el análisis y gestión de datos financieros, con especial enfoque en productos de Markets.
· Dominio avanzado de Excel y capacidad para trabajar con bases de datos.
· Habilidades analíticas, atención al detalle y capacidad para optimizar procesos.
· Facilidad para trabajar de manera colaborativa con áreas de riesgo, tecnología y operaciones.
¿Qué ofrecemos?
· Modalidad de trabajo híbrido.
· Acceso a formación continua.
· Salario competitivo, negociable según experiencia.
· Retribución flexible.

4175127310.title: Pricing Analyst
4175127310.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Analista de Pricing Grupo FireSobre Grupo Fire:Grupo Fire es un líder destacado en la industria de protección contra incendios en España, contando con más de 300 profesionales, una base de clientes que supera los 50,000, y operaciones en seis regiones.

Conocidos por nuestro compromiso con la seguridad y la calidad, estamos en constante expansión y evolución para satisfacer las necesidades de nuestros clientes y del mercado.Estamos creciendo y en 2025 seremos la principal compañía de protección contra incendios en España.Descripción del Puesto:Buscamos un Analista de Pricing Estratégico que se especialice en la utilización de grandes bases de datos de clientes para identificar patrones de precios y oportunidades de optimización.

Este rol es clave para maximizar la rentabilidad y retención de clientes mediante ajustes estratégicos en la estructura de precios.Responsabilidades Clave:Analizar extensas bases de datos de clientes para identificar patrones y tendencias en precios por tipo de cliente, servicio, área geográfica y tamaño de cliente.Desarrollar modelos predictivos para determinar oportunidades de incremento de precios y evaluar el impacto potencial en la retención y rentabilidad.Trabajar en conjunto con los equipos de operaciones y comerciales para implementar aumentos de precios y asegurar su aceptación en el mercado.Monitorizar y evaluar el impacto de los ajustes de precios en la retención de clientes y la rentabilidad global de la empresa.Realizar seguimiento continuo y análisis de la correlación entre incrementos de precios y cambios en la dinámica del mercado y comportamiento del cliente.Calificaciones:Título universitario en Economía, Finanzas, Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería Industrial o campo relacionado.Al menos 3-5 años de experiencia en análisis de datos o roles analíticos financieros, con un fuerte enfoque en análisis de bases de datos grandes.Experiencia específica en roles de pricing, incluyendo el desarrollo de estrategias de precios y evaluación de su efectividad.Experiencia en modelado de datos, análisis predictivo y herramientas analíticas avanzadas.Competencia comprobada para trabajar con datos complejos y realizar análisis cuantitativos detallados.Excelentes habilidades comunicativas, con fluidez en español e inglés.Lo Que Ofrecemos:Salario competitivo con compensación variable basada en el rendimiento.Oportunidades de crecimiento acelerado en una empresa que está expandiendo su tamaño anualmente.Un ambiente colaborativo con un equipo de alto calibre.Formación continua y oportunidades de desarrollo profesional.Proceso de Aplicación:Los candidatos interesados deben enviar su currículum y una carta de presentación explicando sus calificaciones e interés en el puesto a ******ón: Barcelona o Madrid, EspañaTipo de Contrato: Tiempo completo, IndefinidoFecha de Inicio: Inmediata

4176447484.title: Finance Analyst Intern
4176447484.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
En Impulsa CFO, apoyamos a Corporates, Startups, Fondos de VC/PE y PYMES con soluciones financieras estratégicas y operativas.

Si te interesan las finanzas y quieres aprender trabajando con empresas reales, buscamos un Finance Analyst Intern para incorporarse a nuestro equipo.

¿Qué harás?

Apoyar en el análisis financiero y la construcción de modelos en Excel.Colaborar en la preparación de reportes financieros y métricas clave para clientes.Dar soporte en procesos operativos y estratégicos en diferentes industrias.Participar en el seguimiento de inversiones y la preparación de información para fondos y startups.Ayudar en tareas contables y de control financiero según necesidades de los clientes. ¿Qué buscamos en ti?

Estudiante o recién graduado en ADE, Economía, Finanzas o carreras afines.Excel avanzado, incluyendo modelización financiera.Mentalidad analítica, autonomía y ganas de aprender.Inglés es un plus. ¿Qué ofrecemos?

Prácticas remuneradas con flexibilidad entre 20 y 35 horas semanales.Posibilidad de contratación al finalizar las prácticas.Aprendizaje en un entorno dinámico con clientes de distintos sectores.Oportunidad de trabajar en proyectos de alto impacto en el ecosistema financiero. ¿Te interesa?

Envíanos tu CV a ****** con el asunto: Finance Analyst Intern – [Tu Nombre]

4142892647.title: Transfer Pricing Analyst
4142892647.description:
About the job
About Us

HORSE is a global leader in the automotive industry, dedicated to pioneering low-emission and alternative-fuel power solutions. With a presence across seven countries, our mission is to drive the transition to a sustainable future by developing next-generation hybrid, synthetic, and hydrogen-fueled powertrains. We believe in a pragmatic approach to decarbonization, recognizing that there is no one-size-fits-all solution to sustainable mobility.

At the heart of our success is our people. We foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and inclusivity, ensuring that every team member feels valued and empowered. Our global footprint not only drives technological advancement but also generates opportunities for personal and professional growth.

Join us at HORSE, and be part of a team that’s transforming the future of mobility, while building a career that matters.

What You Will Do

 Definition and implementation of Transfer pricing Group policies
Assist in the definition and control of the global transfer pricing policies for Horse Group. This includes leveraging & partnering with the Countries' tax teams, non-tax colleagues & tax service providers in meeting all transfer pricing responsibilities.
Monitoring the overall transfer pricing strategy for Horse Group.
Participate in global planning-continuous optimization of inter-company transactions, as well as ensure global consistency checks for all transfer pricing related issues
Ensure that proper internal controls are in place and assist in the documentation of these controls.
 Ensure compliance for Transfer pricing processes
Oversight and assistance in the preparation of the Master File and Local File transfer pricing compliance reports consistent with OECD BEPS and local country requirements.
Build efficient compliance processes that accomplish business objectives and enforce the correct implementation within Horse Group.
Responsibilities include maintaining a deep understanding of Horse business, various entities, transaction flows, risks, and functions, selecting pricing methods to apply and advising on the various intercompany transactions, relationships, and agreements.
 Other Transfer pricing responsibilities
Provide support in tax audits for transfer pricing positions and issues and tax controversy matters, including double tax relief through Mutual Agreement Procedures.
Evaluate tax return positions and monitor changes in transfer pricing laws and regulations and communicate those changes to the appropriate stakeholders.
Assist in tax provision reporting for transfer pricing positions.

What We Are Looking For

Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Finance, Accounting or Law.
Master degree in Tax.
From 4 years of experience in Transfer Pricing in the advisory firm practice, industry practice, or a combination of both.
Experience managing global transfer pricing with numerous cross-border flows.
Demonstrated ability to manage tax projects and be able to interact with key business partners and other external members across the organization.
Strong (English) verbal and written communications skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complicated tax technical issues.

What We Offer

Lead critical strategic initiatives in a forward-thinking company.
Opportunities for professional development and advancement in a strategic leadership role.
Join a diverse and international team dedicated to excellence and continuous improvement.
Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance, pension plan, and more.

We believe that diversity drives innovation, and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

4174881184.title: Finance and Accounting Systems Analyst- 100% remote (French fluently)
4174881184.description:
About the job
We are looking for a Finance and Accounting Systems Analyst to join the team of our important European client

📍Location: Available from Spain

💻Modality: 100% remote

RESPONSABILITIES:

✅Monitor process related transactions including incoming/outgoing interfaces.

✅ Analyse and solve interface/batch input errors/anomalies.

✅ Maintain application mapping tables.

✅ Define respective customizing settings.

✅ Support change requests including requirement analysis, writing functional specifications, testing and post go-live follow-up.

✅ Provide business with training to new end users and second level support to key user.

✅ Search for information required to solve errors/implement changes.

✅ Communicate new system changes.

✅ Ensure quality of data transferred and quickly resolution of errors/anomalies.

✅ Serve application access management including authorization profile definition.

Requirements:

✨ Master Degree in Finance or Accounting.

✨ Fluent English.

✨ Speak French fluently.

✨ Good process and system overview on Direct and Indirect Material Flows is about the knowledge in MM processes for contracts/purchase orders/good receptions (most interfaces to be checked in this position are related to purchase orders and receptions).

✨ Knowledge in SAP required.

✨ Practical experienced in Accounts Payable processes and Interfaces flow processes and Interfaces Flow.

✨ Good written/oral communication skills – formal/informal.

✨ Proactive agile working style.

✨ Ability to set priorities.

✨ Ability to document and follow up.

Benefits

🎯Freelance Contract: Offering flexibility and independence in your professional engagement.

🚀Exciting Role: Work on impactful projects that contribute to the digital transformation.

👉Immediate Start: Jump into action without long waiting periods.

⏰Contract Duration: A long-term

Apply directly in this post or you can also send us your updated CV to jobs@sapindex.es 📩

Benefits

4169918176.title: Models Portfolio Intelligence & Strategy Design
4169918176.description:
About the job
GROUP BNP PARIBAS

BNP Paribas Group is the top bank in the European Union and a major international banking establishment. It has close to 185,000 employees in 65 countries. In Spain we are more than 5,100 employees within 13 business lines.

RISK HUB

RISK is an integrated and independent control function of the BNP Paribas Group. It is the second line of defense on the risk management activities of the Group which are under its direct responsibilities, including credit and counterparty risk, market risk, funding and liquidity risk, interest rate and foreign exchange risks in the banking book, insurance risk, operational risk, and environmental and social risks.

RISK aims at being a partner of the businesses by contributing to their sustainable development, but also a gatekeeper to ensure risks taken remain compatible with the Group’s Risk Appetite and its strategy.

RISK Iberian Hub Madrid is a transversal platform servicing the RISK Function by covering added-value activities around credit risk, market risk, operational risk and data protection. Offering a wide range of services to RISK teams, from consulting to cyber security going through data analysis, modelling or artificial intelligence.

About The Job

MISSION

Are you passionate about numbers? Is your drive to produce THE right information that will enable THE right decision? Join us!

Within your team (3 FTEs), you will perform simulations on the credit risk exposure portfolio to set decisive directions, such as choosing the regulatory approach (A-IRB or Standard) applied to a specific scope or determining the future of one or more models. You define the indicators that facilitate decision-making. You assess the impact on the evolution of the Bank's RWA and collaborate with the provisions teams to measure the effects.

You share the results obtained, help your numerous clients (from operational staff and top managers to RISK and Business Lines) understand these indicators, and ensure communication alignment with Finance & Strategy.

Your indicators may lead to launching projects, and you will be involved in scoping them.

You maintain the tools that produce these numbers.

Requirements

Studies

Graduated from at least a master's degree with a specialization in finance, risk, data science, statistics or economics

Experience

At least 4 years with following business fields: Data Intelligence, Supervision, Capital Requirements Regulation, Credit Risk Management, Internal Models

Languages

Proficient in English

Skills

Technical
Data Processing - with Excel/SAS/Python (Expert)
Data Visualization - with Excel/Python/R/Power BI/Tableau (Expert)
Credit risk modelling (Proficient)
Capital Requirement related Regulatory environment (Proficient)
Relationship management with Supervisors (Proficient)
Transversal & Behavioral
Critical thinking
Ability to create relevant indicators
Attention to Detail / Rigour
Ability to explain technical topics in simple terms
Ability to develop and adapt a process 
Communication Skills - Oral & Written

Benefits

 Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.
 Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).
 Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.
 Flexible compensation plan.
 Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).
 31 vacation days.

Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.
GROUP BNP PARIBAS
RISK HUB

4142638397.title: Analista / Controlling Financiero/a
4142638397.description:
About the job
Somos Sesé, una organización empresarial española líder en el sector de la logística integral, consolidada como proveedor Tier 1 y Supply Chain Solution de los principales fabricantes de automoción, busca un/a ANALISTA FINANCIERO /CONTROLLER FINANCIERO. 

Nuestro equipo está formado por más de 13.000 personas en 20 países. Nuestro gran valor y principal característica para nuestros clientes es la oferta de servicios más allá del transporte o almacenamiento, participando activamente en las cadenas de suministro de nuestros clientes, aportando soluciones innovadoras y de alto valor añadido a sus necesidades de externalización.

Misión Del Puesto

Analizar los datos financieros y las tendencias internas y externas, para la elaboración de informes que permitan la planificación y adopción de las decisiones más adecuadas.

¿Qué harás con nosotros?

En dependencia de la responsable de Controlling

Apoyo en el proceso de cierre mensual
Participación en la creación del presupuesto, forecast y revisiones
Creación y actualización de los planes de negocio de la compañía y sus divisiones.
Implementación y automatización de procesos
Supervisión y garantizar precisión en los registros financieros
Preparación y análisis de estados financieros, informes y previsiones para proporcionar información financiera rigurosa y precisa a Dirección y terceros.
Gestionar el proceso de presentación de informes financieros, incluyendo la preparación de estados financieros analíticos.

¿Qué buscamos?

Grado en Economía o Administración
Experiencia de al menos 2-3 años como controller financiero y/o auditoria.
Nivel ingles Alto ( C1 ) 
Valorable – conocimientos Navision
Dominio Ato paquete Office (especialmente Excel) y valorables conocimientos en otros sistemas de gestión de datos (PowerBI, QS)
Competencias personales: Analítico, Capacidad de organización, orientación a objetivos, proactividad en propuesta de mejoras y capacidad adaptación. Habilidades de comunicación e interpersonales. Capacidad trabajo en equipo.
Disponibilidad para viajar (de forma ocasional)

¿Qué puedes esperar?

Formarás parte de un proyecto en expansión: te ofrecemos desarrollo profesional.
Desempeñarás un papel activo en la configuración del crecimiento del grupo.
Te ofrecemos un alto grado de autonomía dentro de un equipo motivado.
Acceso a Beneficios sociales por pertenecer a Grupo Sesé: seguro médico, comedor buffet, descuentos en más de 400 marcas etc.

¿Quieres presentarte?

¡Da el paso decisivo e inscríbete! Estamos deseando recibir tu solicitud 🙂.
Somos Sesé

4090995469.title: Junior Portfolio Analyst

4163471220.title: Pricing Analyst
4163471220.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Analista de Pricing Grupo FireSobre Grupo Fire:Grupo Fire es un líder destacado en la industria de protección contra incendios en España, contando con más de 300 profesionales, una base de clientes que supera los 50,000, y operaciones en seis regiones.

Conocidos por nuestro compromiso con la seguridad y la calidad, estamos en constante expansión y evolución para satisfacer las necesidades de nuestros clientes y del mercado.Estamos creciendo y en 2025 seremos la principal compañía de protección contra incendios en España.Descripción del Puesto:Buscamos un Analista de Pricing Estratégico que se especialice en la utilización de grandes bases de datos de clientes para identificar patrones de precios y oportunidades de optimización.

Este rol es clave para maximizar la rentabilidad y retención de clientes mediante ajustes estratégicos en la estructura de precios.Responsabilidades Clave:Analizar extensas bases de datos de clientes para identificar patrones y tendencias en precios por tipo de cliente, servicio, área geográfica y tamaño de cliente.Desarrollar modelos predictivos para determinar oportunidades de incremento de precios y evaluar el impacto potencial en la retención y rentabilidad.Trabajar en conjunto con los equipos de operaciones y comerciales para implementar aumentos de precios y asegurar su aceptación en el mercado.Monitorizar y evaluar el impacto de los ajustes de precios en la retención de clientes y la rentabilidad global de la empresa.Realizar seguimiento continuo y análisis de la correlación entre incrementos de precios y cambios en la dinámica del mercado y comportamiento del cliente.Calificaciones:Título universitario en Economía, Finanzas, Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería Industrial o campo relacionado.Al menos 3-5 años de experiencia en análisis de datos o roles analíticos financieros, con un fuerte enfoque en análisis de bases de datos grandes.Experiencia específica en roles de pricing, incluyendo el desarrollo de estrategias de precios y evaluación de su efectividad.Experiencia en modelado de datos, análisis predictivo y herramientas analíticas avanzadas.Competencia comprobada para trabajar con datos complejos y realizar análisis cuantitativos detallados.Excelentes habilidades comunicativas, con fluidez en español e inglés.Lo Que Ofrecemos:Salario competitivo con compensación variable basada en el rendimiento.Oportunidades de crecimiento acelerado en una empresa que está expandiendo su tamaño anualmente.Un ambiente colaborativo con un equipo de alto calibre.Formación continua y oportunidades de desarrollo profesional.Proceso de Aplicación:Los candidatos interesados deben enviar su currículum y una carta de presentación explicando sus calificaciones e interés en el puesto a ******ón: Barcelona o Madrid, EspañaTipo de Contrato: Tiempo completo, IndefinidoFecha de Inicio: Inmediata

4176444964.title: Finance Analyst Intern
4176444964.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
En Impulsa CFO, apoyamos a Corporates, Startups, Fondos de VC/PE y PYMES con soluciones financieras estratégicas y operativas.

Si te interesan las finanzas y quieres aprender trabajando con empresas reales, buscamos un Finance Analyst Intern para incorporarse a nuestro equipo.

¿Qué harás?

Apoyar en el análisis financiero y la construcción de modelos en Excel.Colaborar en la preparación de reportes financieros y métricas clave para clientes.Dar soporte en procesos operativos y estratégicos en diferentes industrias.Participar en el seguimiento de inversiones y la preparación de información para fondos y startups.Ayudar en tareas contables y de control financiero según necesidades de los clientes. ¿Qué buscamos en ti?

Estudiante o recién graduado en ADE, Economía, Finanzas o carreras afines.Excel avanzado, incluyendo modelización financiera.Mentalidad analítica, autonomía y ganas de aprender.Inglés es un plus. ¿Qué ofrecemos?

Prácticas remuneradas con flexibilidad entre 20 y 35 horas semanales.Posibilidad de contratación al finalizar las prácticas.Aprendizaje en un entorno dinámico con clientes de distintos sectores.Oportunidad de trabajar en proyectos de alto impacto en el ecosistema financiero. ¿Te interesa?

Envíanos tu CV a ****** con el asunto: Finance Analyst Intern – [Tu Nombre]

About the job
We are currently seeking a Calypso Front Office Analyst to join our team! We are looking for a professional with at least +5 years of experience in projects in the finance industry (desirable in capital markets), with verifiable experience in product integration services (agile dynamics and software implementation world class).

Who we are at Exadel

Exadel is a global software consulting and development company that partners with organizations to help them become digital leaders in their industries. We look beyond the code to understand the impact our clients want to make and help them get from ideation to development and outcomes. We accelerate the results of digital transformations through an open, collaborative approach combined with our deep experience across industries, business processes, and technologies.

Exadel Financial Services is the financial arm of our organization, specializing in banking, capital markets strategy and technology consulting. Exadel is committed to service excellence and being a great place to work.

4167003802.title: Scoring/Rating Models Analyst - SCF
4167003802.location: Boadilla del Monte, Community of Madrid, Spain
4167003802.description:
About the job
Country: Spain

Santander Consumer Finance is looking for a Scoring/Rating Models Analyst based in our Boadilla del Monte (Madrid) offices.

WHY YOU SHOULD CONSIDER THIS OPPORTUNITY

At Santander (www.santander.com) we are key players in the transformation of the financial sector. Do you want to join us?

Santander Consumer Finance focuses on business development related to consumer finance products, sales channels and commercial agreements with dealers, vehicle manufacturers or retail distribution establishments, as well as commercial functions associated with direct sales (branches, call centers or digital channels) and indirect sales (through third parties) of consumer finance products.

Santander is proud of being an organization where there are equal opportunities regardless of gender identity, culture and disability. Our mission is to contribute to help more people and business prosper.

What You Will Be Doing

As a Scoring/Rating Models Analyst you will develop, monitor and maintain models, focusing in Credit Risk models in Santander Consumer Finance.

We need someone like you to help us in different fronts:

 Development of risk models (admission, behaviour, fraud, propensity/affordability, residual value, etc.): plan and execute models workplans agreed with different sponsors; develop models according to internal standards and guidelines, different sponsors needs and regulatory requirements, subject to data availability and data Quality; document and deliver the materials according to internal Group/local standards; support/participate during implementation phase (pre-production, allocation, etc.); securitization processes support; etc. 
 Monitoring of risk models performance and report: execute and/or support the execution of monitoring reports; analyze the results of the monitoring on a proper and timely manner, proposing the actions which are needed in each case. 
 Maintenance of Risk models: assure an adequate maintenance of models in force executing the actions which are needed in each case (recalibrate, adjust, time window updates, etc.) according to the results of the models monitoring, internal standards and different sponsor’s needs. 
 Governance of risk models: accompany the governance processes and supervisory exercises (Internal Validation, Internal Audit, ECB/NCAs), assuring that the recommendations/obligations related to the development and maintenance of models are met on a proper and timely manner. 
 Transformation and evolution projects: participate and/or sponsor local and global projects related to the digital transformation strategy in SCF (Data as a Service, migrations to new platforms, bottom-up approaches in stress models, industrialization/automation, etc.). 
 Adaptation of standards and guidelines to SCF idiosyncrasy and propose new ones for digital approaches. 

Experience

At least 1-2 years of experience in admission, behaviour, fraud, propensity/affordability, residual value, etc.modelling.

EDUCATION

Quantitative education oriented

Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics,Economics. 
Master in Quantitative Finance / Banking or similar. 

Skills & Knowledge

Knowledge on scoring/rating modelling. 
Team work; multicultural environments
Management skills valuable (PMI, Agile, etc);
High level of programming skills in different languages (SAS, Python, R, Others)
Fluent English (C1), spoken and written. 

If you want to know more about us, follow us on https://es.linkedin.com/company/banco-santander

Adaptation of standards and guidelines to SCF idiosyncrasy and propose new ones for digital approaches.

Master in Quantitative Finance / Banking or similar.

Fluent English (C1), spoken and written.

4176450016.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
En Impulsa CFO, apoyamos a Corporates, Startups, Fondos de VC/PE y PYMES con soluciones financieras estratégicas y operativas.

Si te interesan las finanzas y quieres aprender trabajando con empresas reales, buscamos un Finance Analyst Intern para incorporarse a nuestro equipo.

¿Qué harás?

Apoyar en el análisis financiero y la construcción de modelos en Excel.Colaborar en la preparación de reportes financieros y métricas clave para clientes.Dar soporte en procesos operativos y estratégicos en diferentes industrias.Participar en el seguimiento de inversiones y la preparación de información para fondos y startups.Ayudar en tareas contables y de control financiero según necesidades de los clientes. ¿Qué buscamos en ti?

Estudiante o recién graduado en ADE, Economía, Finanzas o carreras afines.Excel avanzado, incluyendo modelización financiera.Mentalidad analítica, autonomía y ganas de aprender.Inglés es un plus. ¿Qué ofrecemos?

Prácticas remuneradas con flexibilidad entre 20 y 35 horas semanales.Posibilidad de contratación al finalizar las prácticas.Aprendizaje en un entorno dinámico con clientes de distintos sectores.Oportunidad de trabajar en proyectos de alto impacto en el ecosistema financiero. ¿Te interesa?

4167174264.title: Pricing Analyst
4167174264.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Analista de Pricing Grupo FireSobre Grupo Fire:Grupo Fire es un líder destacado en la industria de protección contra incendios en España, contando con más de 300 profesionales, una base de clientes que supera los 50,000, y operaciones en seis regiones.

Conocidos por nuestro compromiso con la seguridad y la calidad, estamos en constante expansión y evolución para satisfacer las necesidades de nuestros clientes y del mercado.Estamos creciendo y en 2025 seremos la principal compañía de protección contra incendios en España.Descripción del Puesto:Buscamos un Analista de Pricing Estratégico que se especialice en la utilización de grandes bases de datos de clientes para identificar patrones de precios y oportunidades de optimización.

Este rol es clave para maximizar la rentabilidad y retención de clientes mediante ajustes estratégicos en la estructura de precios.Responsabilidades Clave:Analizar extensas bases de datos de clientes para identificar patrones y tendencias en precios por tipo de cliente, servicio, área geográfica y tamaño de cliente.Desarrollar modelos predictivos para determinar oportunidades de incremento de precios y evaluar el impacto potencial en la retención y rentabilidad.Trabajar en conjunto con los equipos de operaciones y comerciales para implementar aumentos de precios y asegurar su aceptación en el mercado.Monitorizar y evaluar el impacto de los ajustes de precios en la retención de clientes y la rentabilidad global de la empresa.Realizar seguimiento continuo y análisis de la correlación entre incrementos de precios y cambios en la dinámica del mercado y comportamiento del cliente.Calificaciones:Título universitario en Economía, Finanzas, Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería Industrial o campo relacionado.Al menos 3-5 años de experiencia en análisis de datos o roles analíticos financieros, con un fuerte enfoque en análisis de bases de datos grandes.Experiencia específica en roles de pricing, incluyendo el desarrollo de estrategias de precios y evaluación de su efectividad.Experiencia en modelado de datos, análisis predictivo y herramientas analíticas avanzadas.Competencia comprobada para trabajar con datos complejos y realizar análisis cuantitativos detallados.Excelentes habilidades comunicativas, con fluidez en español e inglés.Lo Que Ofrecemos:Salario competitivo con compensación variable basada en el rendimiento.Oportunidades de crecimiento acelerado en una empresa que está expandiendo su tamaño anualmente.Un ambiente colaborativo con un equipo de alto calibre.Formación continua y oportunidades de desarrollo profesional.Proceso de Aplicación:Los candidatos interesados deben enviar su currículum y una carta de presentación explicando sus calificaciones e interés en el puesto a ******ón: Barcelona o Madrid, EspañaTipo de Contrato: Tiempo completo, IndefinidoFecha de Inicio: Inmediata

4145354409.title: International Finance Analyst
4145354409.description:
About the job
HIPRA es una empresa farmacéutica y biotecnológica enfocada en la prevención y diagnóstico para salud animal y humana, con una amplia gama de vacunas altamente innovadoras y un avanzado servicio de diagnóstico.

Tiene una sólida presencia internacional en más de 40 países con filiales propias, 11 centros de diagnóstico y 6 plantas de producción ubicadas estratégicamente en Europa (España) y América (Brasil).

La investigación y el desarrollo constituyen el núcleo de su conocimiento. HIPRA dedica el 15% de su facturación anual a actividades de I+D que se concentran en la creación y aplicación de los últimos avances científicos para el desarrollo de vacunas innovadoras de la más alta calidad. Para darle un valor añadido a su experiencia en vacunación, la empresa también desarrolla dispositivos médicos y servicios de trazabilidad. International Finance Analyst

Actualmente, necesitamos incorporar un(a) nuevo(a) International Finance Analyst, para nuestras oficinas en Aiguaviva (Girona).

Buscamos Personas Que

Tengan un Grado en ADE, Económicas, Administración y Finanzas o similar. 
Cuenten con una experiencia profesional mínima de 2 años en funciones de contabilidad. 
Tengan un nivel alto de inglés (C1) hablado y escrito. 
Tengan un nivel avanzado de Excel y otras herramientas ofimáticas. 
Se valorará experiencia en SAP u otros programas de gestión similares. 
Sean proactivas, buenas comunicadoras, analíticas y autónomas. 

En Hipra Podrás Encontrar

Aprendizaje continuo.
Una empresa en plena expansión, multinacional. 
Ambiente multicultural, abierto a nuevas ideas. 
Posiciones de trabajo estables. 

Tareas Principales Del Puesto

Llevar a cabo a implementación y seguimiento de nuevos procedimientos y herramientas de gestión interna 
Asegurar que los SOPs de los principales procedimientos están actualizados y vigentes. 
Realizar cierres mensuales de filiales no operativas. 
Dar soporte contable y administrativo a algunas filiales. 
Automatización de procesos.

4034208161.title: IFRS Reporting Analyst
4034208161.description:
About the job
GROUP BNP PARIBAS

BNP Paribas Group is the top bank in the European Union and a major international banking establishment. It has close to 185,000 employees in 65 countries. In Spain we are more than 5,100 employees within 13 business lines.

Infinity Finance HUB

BNP Paribas EMEA Finance employs 500 employees, of which more than 325 are based in Madrid. We manage more than 250 BNP Paribas entities from all over Europe, covering +60% of Group’s balance sheet and all group’s banking activities (Corporate & Investment Banking, Retail Banking, Personal Finance and other financial services activities…).

Our mission is to measure, control and explain all the financial indicators required to monitor accounting, tax, regulatory, liquidity, credit risk reporting and management result activities.

About The Job

MISSION

Preparation of regular financial reporting information, IFRS reporting & data quality controls, IFRS projects implementation

Responsibilities

Monthly controls over the reliability of reporting information. Quarterly financial reporting.

Requirements

Studies

University Graduate

Experience

Experience in audit or accounting / reporting /related functions, Experience of working in international environment is a plus

2 to 5 years of experience, good knowledge of finance.

Languages

English: Fluent

French is a plus

Skills

Technical

Excel fluent

SAP

Transversal & Behavioral

Ability to collaborate/Teamwork

Analytical ability

Creativity & Innovation/Problem solving

Benefits

 Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.
 Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).
 Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.
 Flexible compensation plan.
 Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).
 31 vacation days.

Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Infinity Finance HUB

Prácticas remuneradas con flexibilidad entre 20 y 35 horas semanales.Posibilidad de contratación al finalizar las prácticas.Aprendizaje en un entorno dinámico con clientes de distintos sectores.Oportunidad de trabajar en proyectos de alto impacto en el ecosistema financiero. ¿Te interesa?
