4093403217.title: Analyst M&A Financial Institutions Iberia
4093403217.description:
About the job
GROUP BNP PARIBAS

BNP Paribas Group is the top bank in the European Union and a major international banking establishment. It has close to 185,000 employees in 65 countries. In Spain we are more than 5,100 employees within 13 business lines.

CIB

BNP Paribas Corporate & Institutional Banking provides large companies, multinationals and financial institutions with various solutions in the areas of advisory, financing, transactional banking, capital markets, settlement, clearing and custody of securities, asset and fund management services and solutions for corporate issuers. It has 620 professionals in Spain with offices in Madrid, Barcelona, Bilbao and Coruña. The entity has a network present in 56 countries.

Overall responsibilities

Opportunity to be part of a leading advisory team, assisting clients, primarily Iberian Financial Institutions (i.e. banks, insurance, asset managers, fintechs) in defining their long-term strategy and inorganic growth plans with views to maximising value for its key stakeholders 
Be part of the team leading landmark transactions that have an impact in the future of Spanish and Portuguese financial sector 
The work in FIC Advisory The r includes two main type of tasks: (i) marketing materials, in which the team proactively presents ideas to the client, and (ii) executions, where the team advises clients in strategic transactions, which comprise sellsides, buysides, IPOs, take private, partnerships, etc. 
An analyst’s responsibility is to support the team (MD / Director / VP / Associate) in both workstreams and its specific responsibilities are:
Conduct market and sector research and companies research
Understand and analyse the financial information of financial institutions
Analyse diligently and with good judgement the information and present it in a clear and concise manner 
Prepare thoughtful presentations for clients 
Conduct financial analysis, including business projections, valuation models 
Take responsibility for the tasks delegated by VP / Associate
Deliver best-in-class materials in a competitive industry requiring the highest standards for clients 
Marketing materials

Prepare client presentations autonomously on the basis of guidelines and supervision of the Associate, VP, Director and Managing Director
Preparation of a presentation includes (i) conducting the required research, (ii) analysing the information, (iii) preparing financial analysis, (iv) selecting the relevant information and prepare slides in a concise and self-explanatory manner, (v) reviewing the presentation with the Associate and Managing Director
Preparation of follow ups for the client in a timely manner
Appropriate exposure to clients when possible under direct supervision of Managing Director


Transaction Execution

Assist Managing Director / Associate in key steps of an execution. Executions include: sellside, buyside, take private, fairness opinions, IPOs for instance
Prepare models autonomously (trading/ transaction multiples, Business Plan and DDM) or under supervision of Associate for more complex analyses (LBO, Merger Model) 
Prepare presentations for clients in its decision making process for Top Management, Executive Committees, Board Members 
Prepare sell side materials (descriptive sections of Information Memorandum, data rooms, drafting of management presentation), buyside materials, IPO materials, valuation materials, fairness opinions, etc 


Presentation & communication

Excellent communication skills, both orally and written, and presentation skills 
Present and explain clearly results of research & analyses to Associate / MD
Ability to communicate in a concise and summarised manner, giving the relevant information


Modelling and technical skills

Prepare financial and valuation models for marketing purposes and executions
Excel in modelling skills, analytical and numerical tasks, including accounting, financial and valuation techniques


Team responsibilities

Contribute to recruitment and training of interns 
Ability to collaborate and work in team


Essential

Profile

Demonstrate strong interest in Corporate Finance, mergers & acquisitions and understand key responsibilities/tasks of the job
Strong interest in financial institutions resulting in being up to date on the sector, macro economy, mergers and acquisitions, general sector knowledge
Proactive approach, eagerness to learn, inquisitive and questions the status quo
Take accountability and ownership of its own responsibilities
Works independently and with autonomy. Problem solver 
Excellent organisational skills, with strong ability to multi-task
Capability to work under tight deadlines, excellent time management and prioritisation
Demonstrate rigour and reliability for her / his own work 
Team spirit, collaborative and inclusive way of working
High standard performance in a competitive industry advising key clients in very visible and important transactions


Technical competencies

Excellent knowledge of accounting, financial and valuation techniques
Strong numerical and analytical ability, aptitude to think strategically
Numerical and analytical skills with strong modelling skills (DDM, multiples, basic LBO model, basic merger model and value creation analyses…)
Knowledge of process and key steps for major types of transactions (sell side, buy side, LBO, public offer, IPO)


Other Important Competencies

Strong academic background, Master Degree in Finance, Management, Economics, Engineering area/s
Current or past experience in working in Corporate Finance and in particular in Financial Institutions Corporate
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Fluency in English is compulsory, any European languages a plus 
At ease with Microsoft Office tools, FactSet, Bloomberg and other information database


Benefits

 Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.
 Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).
 Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.
 Flexible compensation plan.
 31 vacation days.


Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.
GROUP BNP PARIBAS

4176447488.title: Finance Analyst Intern
4176447488.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
En Impulsa CFO, apoyamos a Corporates, Startups, Fondos de VC/PE y PYMES con soluciones financieras estratégicas y operativas.

Si te interesan las finanzas y quieres aprender trabajando con empresas reales, buscamos un Finance Analyst Intern para incorporarse a nuestro equipo.

¿Qué harás?

Apoyar en el análisis financiero y la construcción de modelos en Excel.Colaborar en la preparación de reportes financieros y métricas clave para clientes.Dar soporte en procesos operativos y estratégicos en diferentes industrias.Participar en el seguimiento de inversiones y la preparación de información para fondos y startups.Ayudar en tareas contables y de control financiero según necesidades de los clientes. ¿Qué buscamos en ti?

Estudiante o recién graduado en ADE, Economía, Finanzas o carreras afines.Excel avanzado, incluyendo modelización financiera.Mentalidad analítica, autonomía y ganas de aprender.Inglés es un plus. ¿Qué ofrecemos?

Prácticas remuneradas con flexibilidad entre 20 y 35 horas semanales.Posibilidad de contratación al finalizar las prácticas.Aprendizaje en un entorno dinámico con clientes de distintos sectores.Oportunidad de trabajar en proyectos de alto impacto en el ecosistema financiero. ¿Te interesa?

4176447505.title: Junior Financial Analyst - Corporate Operations & Due Diligence
4176447505.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Junior Financial Analyst - Corporate Operations & Due DiligenceAmadix Valladolid, Castilla and Leon, SpainAmadix is a biotech company developing innovative tests for early cancer detection by last-generation liquid biopsy, which impact patient survival and quality of life.

We are a growing company that offers significant career opportunities if you are curious, driven, patient-oriented, and aspire to help us build a great company.Job Summary:Amadix is an innovative and fast-growing startup with a young and dynamic team focused on transforming the industry sector through disruptive solutions.

We are looking for a Junior Financial Analyst to join our finance team and support the CFO in fundraising activities, corporate operations, due diligence processes, and managing our data room, while assisting with the preparation of corporate documentation.This position will report directly to the company's CFO.Key Tasks & Responsibilities:Support to Fundraising & Private Financing: Assist the CFO in identifying, targeting, and securing private funding from international investors, venture capital, and private equity sources.Prepare Fundraising Documentation: Support the preparation of key investment materials, such as business plans, investor decks, financial models, and presentations for fundraising rounds and help engage with potential investors.Assist in Closing Funding Rounds: Support in the preparation and negotiation of funding rounds, manage investor communications, deal structuring, and ensure all financial documentation is accurate and ready for review.Investor Negotiation Support: Provide assistance in negotiations with investors, ensuring that the financial terms are aligned with the company's goals and priorities.Due Diligence Documentation: Assist in organizing and preparing due diligence documentation (financial, legal, tax, etc.)

in close collaboration with the CFO, legal, and accounting teams.Manage the Data room: Help maintain and organize the data room, ensuring that all relevant documentation is up to date, structured correctly, and accessible to both internal and external stakeholders.Corporate Documentation: Provide support in the preparation of financial reports, contracts, and other corporate documents required for due diligence, fundraising, and business operations.Collaborate with Internal Teams: Work with cross-functional teams to ensure that corporate documents and processes are aligned and meet the necessary standards and timelines.Document Review & Quality Assurance: Ensure all financial and corporate documents are validated and meet the required standards before being shared with investors, auditors, or external parties.Financial Analysis Support: Assist in the preparation of financial models, reports, and assessments for corporate operations, fundraising, and strategic projects.Support Strategic Initiatives: Provide analytical support for key corporate projects and initiatives, ensuring the proper documentation and data are prepared for internal decision-making.Qualifications:Education: Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or a related field.Previous Experience: Prior experience (including internships) in financial analysis, corporate operations, fundraising, or due diligence processes is preferred.Fundraising Experience: Exposure to private fundraising efforts, preparing pitch decks, managing investor relations, and assisting in closing rounds (preferably in international or venture capital environments).Skills and Knowledge:Familiarity with corporate operations, fundraising, and due diligence processes.Strong financial analysis skills, with experience in financial modeling, reporting, and assessments.Proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel (advanced level), and PowerPoint.Familiarity with data room management tools is a plus.Fluent in English (written and spoken).Strong Analytical & Problem-Solving Skills: Able to manage complex information, analyze data, and offer effective solutions.Attention to Detail & Organizational Skills: Highly organized, able to handle large volumes of information with precision and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.Effective Communication: Clear and concise communication with internal teams, external stakeholders, and investors.

Strong interpersonal skills for building relationships.Team Collaboration: Works well in team settings, fostering teamwork and collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams.Proactive & Results-Driven: Takes initiative, demonstrates a strong sense of urgency, and takes ownership of tasks to drive outcomes.Negotiation & Stakeholder Management: Supports negotiations with investors and ensures alignment with company goals, building strong relationships with both internal and external stakeholders.Flexibility & Travel: Able to adapt to changing environments and travel as needed.What We Offer:This is an exciting opportunity to engage with the biotechnology industry and drive the development of innovative diagnostic solutions in cancer.Competitive salary commensurate with experience.Type of contract: Full time and open end.Opportunities for professional growth and development in a fast-paced, innovative environment.The chance to contribute to groundbreaking advancements in the biotechnology sector.If you are a dynamic individual with a passion for finance and a keen interest in the biotechnology field, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Join us in our mission to make a positive impact on healthcare and scientific innovation.To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter to ****** look forward to reviewing your application and considering you for this pivotal role at Amadix!

4172917621.title: Pricing Analyst
4172917621.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Analista de Pricing Grupo FireSobre Grupo Fire:Grupo Fire es un líder destacado en la industria de protección contra incendios en España, contando con más de 300 profesionales, una base de clientes que supera los 50,000, y operaciones en seis regiones.

Conocidos por nuestro compromiso con la seguridad y la calidad, estamos en constante expansión y evolución para satisfacer las necesidades de nuestros clientes y del mercado.Estamos creciendo y en 2025 seremos la principal compañía de protección contra incendios en España.Descripción del Puesto:Buscamos un Analista de Pricing Estratégico que se especialice en la utilización de grandes bases de datos de clientes para identificar patrones de precios y oportunidades de optimización.

Este rol es clave para maximizar la rentabilidad y retención de clientes mediante ajustes estratégicos en la estructura de precios.Responsabilidades Clave:Analizar extensas bases de datos de clientes para identificar patrones y tendencias en precios por tipo de cliente, servicio, área geográfica y tamaño de cliente.Desarrollar modelos predictivos para determinar oportunidades de incremento de precios y evaluar el impacto potencial en la retención y rentabilidad.Trabajar en conjunto con los equipos de operaciones y comerciales para implementar aumentos de precios y asegurar su aceptación en el mercado.Monitorizar y evaluar el impacto de los ajustes de precios en la retención de clientes y la rentabilidad global de la empresa.Realizar seguimiento continuo y análisis de la correlación entre incrementos de precios y cambios en la dinámica del mercado y comportamiento del cliente.Calificaciones:Título universitario en Economía, Finanzas, Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería Industrial o campo relacionado.Al menos 3-5 años de experiencia en análisis de datos o roles analíticos financieros, con un fuerte enfoque en análisis de bases de datos grandes.Experiencia específica en roles de pricing, incluyendo el desarrollo de estrategias de precios y evaluación de su efectividad.Experiencia en modelado de datos, análisis predictivo y herramientas analíticas avanzadas.Competencia comprobada para trabajar con datos complejos y realizar análisis cuantitativos detallados.Excelentes habilidades comunicativas, con fluidez en español e inglés.Lo Que Ofrecemos:Salario competitivo con compensación variable basada en el rendimiento.Oportunidades de crecimiento acelerado en una empresa que está expandiendo su tamaño anualmente.Un ambiente colaborativo con un equipo de alto calibre.Formación continua y oportunidades de desarrollo profesional.Proceso de Aplicación:Los candidatos interesados deben enviar su currículum y una carta de presentación explicando sus calificaciones e interés en el puesto a ******ón: Barcelona o Madrid, EspañaTipo de Contrato: Tiempo completo, IndefinidoFecha de Inicio: Inmediata

4167171543.title: Finance Analyst Intern
4167171543.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
En Impulsa CFO, apoyamos a Corporates, Startups, Fondos de VC/PE y PYMES con soluciones financieras estratégicas y operativas.

Si te interesan las finanzas y quieres aprender trabajando con empresas reales, buscamos un Finance Analyst Intern para incorporarse a nuestro equipo.

¿Qué harás?

Apoyar en el análisis financiero y la construcción de modelos en Excel.Colaborar en la preparación de reportes financieros y métricas clave para clientes.Dar soporte en procesos operativos y estratégicos en diferentes industrias.Participar en el seguimiento de inversiones y la preparación de información para fondos y startups.Ayudar en tareas contables y de control financiero según necesidades de los clientes. ¿Qué buscamos en ti?

Estudiante o recién graduado en ADE, Economía, Finanzas o carreras afines.Excel avanzado, incluyendo modelización financiera.Mentalidad analítica, autonomía y ganas de aprender.Inglés es un plus. ¿Qué ofrecemos?

Prácticas remuneradas con flexibilidad entre 20 y 35 horas semanales.Posibilidad de contratación al finalizar las prácticas.Aprendizaje en un entorno dinámico con clientes de distintos sectores.Oportunidad de trabajar en proyectos de alto impacto en el ecosistema financiero. ¿Te interesa?

Envíanos tu CV a ****** con el asunto: Finance Analyst Intern – [Tu Nombre]

4075605175.title: Analyst Coverage Corporate Investment Banking
4075605175.description:
About the job
GROUP BNP PARIBAS

BNP Paribas Group is the top bank in the European Union and a major international banking establishment. It has close to 185,000 employees in 65 countries. In Spain we are more than 5,100 employees within 13 business lines.

CIB

BNP Paribas Corporate & Institutional Banking provides large companies, multinationals and financial institutions with various solutions in the areas of advisory, financing, transactional banking, capital markets, settlement, clearing and custody of securities, asset and fund management services and solutions for corporate issuers. It has 620 professionals in Spain with offices in Madrid, Barcelona, Bilbao and Coruña. The entity has a network present in 56 countries.

About The Job

MISIÓN

The Coverage Analyst plays a fundamental role within the Corporate Coverage business model by assuming a key role on 3 dimensions: a strong commercial focus, credit expertise and KYC.

On commercial side, the Coverage Analyst supports the Bankers in the preparation follow up of the Strategic Business Review, and contributes to the development of the client relationship and profitability. He is also in charge of the Multinational Corporations (MNCs) coordination.

Regarding the credit analysis, the Coverage Analyst is responsible for monitoring the overall risks and credit process of a portfolio of Pilot Groups. He contributes to the Green light process and to the structuration of plain vanilla products / loan book transactions.

KYC activity is focused on the more added-value tasks by supporting Bankers in steering the KYC Strategy for their client portfolio.

By covering a large range of topics, the Coverage Analyst will develop high valued skills on these three dimensions

RESPONSABILIDADES

COMMERCIAL


Business Groups Strategy / follow-up of business opportunities

 He/She supports the Banker in the preparation and follow up of the Strategic Business Review:
He/She prepares the Strategic Business review and send it to participants
He/She attends the Strategic Business review and writes the minutes
He/She is responsible for the preparation of budget / forecasts in liaison with the contributors
He/She contributes to the identification of the client needs and discusses with the Banker
 MNCs business coordination:
Local contributors:
He/She creates and updates contact list
He/She identifies relevant client in the portfolio & spot opportunities across geographies
Business Groups contributors’s network:
He/She prepares and updates stakeholders on the Commercial Strategy with the Group
He/She displays minutes of the Reviews, gather feedbacks
He/She schedules the network call & prepare the agenda, feed CRM
Origination/Sales:
He/She maps BG international presence (Org Chart) & local activities
He/She creates and maintains a list of prospects and new clients
He/She gathers information from client / prospects
He/She prepares client meetings (extract fiche client…) and defines topics to be addressed
He/She contributes to client events, calls & meetings, sales/deal related client/prospect interactions
He/She develops presentation/pitches
He/She coordinates pitch document and the rehearsal in interaction with the banker
He/She prepares forecasts based on client business plan and measures impacts of major opportunities on clients financials (when no other Métier involved)
He/She monitors the pipeline and spots client / prospects business opportunities in regards to each products and alerts/discusses with the Banker / team
He/She is encouraged to build junior relationships with the client
 Complex Client Request:
He/She performs a due diligence based on technical documents : RFP, Financial Information in liaison with Banker & BL
He/She gathers relevant document (incl. Preliminary financial information) and sends question list
He/She negociates NDA with the client
He/She supports the Banker in the RFP analysis and deal structuration with the support of the SCA
He/She prepares screening committee
He/She attends the screening discussion on deal with management, Delegation holder and Business Line
 2. CREDIT
 Under the accountability of the Banker(s), and in coordination with the ECA platform, the Coverage Analyst, using his/her credit expertize, will be in charge of the following tasks:
 Monitoring of the overall risks of a portfolio of Pilot Groups (Credit/Counterparty, Compliance and CSR) with the Senior Credit Advisor support:
He/She is responsible for watching & anticipating risks/events at Group level
He/She is responsible for alerting the Banker in case of change(s) and issue(s)
He/She is responsible for regularly updating stakeholders (including ECA) via a one Pager
He/She contributes to the TGA discussion (AR process)
He/She contributes to the management of Resources allocated to their client portfolio, i.e. RWA, CDS, Insurance, …
 Green light process:
He/She is responsible for validating the criteria for denotching/propagation
He/She is informed of any issue on a Business Group contributor by the ECA or the ECH
He/She is responsible for the monitoring of the efficient use of lines (GL responses)
 Credit process of Pilot files:
He/She conducts a sanity check of the Credit Proposal prepared by the ECA
He/She is responsible for the analysis & drafting of the Client Relationship and the deal/risk return part of the Credit Proposal
He/She writes a recommendation on the file/deal (or an executive summary in case of CCDG file)
He/She attends Credit Committee together with the Banker
He/She is responsible for organizing a kick off meeting with the Banker and the ECA (+SCA when needed) for Annual Reviews and relevant New Requests
 Structuring - for plain vanilla products / loan book:
He/She contributes to the discussion on terms and conditions with the client
He/She liaises with Legal on Terms and Conditions
 Contracting plain vanilla products / loan book (and, in option, for structured loan with the Business line when requested):
He/She contributes to the final negotiation:
He/She seeks internal approvals (i) from Risk or CC if changes vs credit decision (ii) from compliance if any change in term of sanctions/AML (iii) from other departments such as Assets and Liquidity Management and Treasury or Legal if certain policy requirements have not been met in the contracts
He/She is responsible for the credit process of amendment to initial credit decision, ECA preparing the Credit Paper
He/She coordinates the review of Sanction wording
 Deal implementation & life cycle:
He/She is responsible for deal implementation and follow up of its life cycle in coordination with product partners / contributor RM/RO, Middle office…
He/She is responsible for the follow up of the Covenants
 Others:
He/She prepares the watch list fiche, the GRR spreadsheet (update : closure) and the CSR screening
He/She attends watch List/Doubtful committee jointly with the Banker
KYC


The Coverage Analyst will take the completion of several added-value tasks within the KYC process:

 He/She supports bankers in steering the KYC Strategy for their client portfolio for both onboarding (raise onboarding request, share priorities with other actors), recertification (conduct profitability review) and trigger event, in consistency with the Credit Process whenever relevant.
 He/She ensures a comprehensive identification of clients’ business needs and the related KYC flag set-up between Primary and Secondary sites in line with Passport and Reliance procedures.
 He/She maintains a close contact with KYC Coordinators / E2E Coordinators / BG Coordinator (whomever relevant) for clients under their responsibility
 He/She informs clients of BNPP KYC process and connects them to the proper KYC Operations SPOC
 By delegation of banker, he/she can prepare call memos, analyze screening hits and complete RMs assessment for any KYC file and can contribute, in limited cases, to the collection of clients’ sensitive documents.
 He/She ensures Compliance with Bank’s policies and regulatory requirements.
 In particular, he/she ensures KYC is in place and up to date for all clients. When necessary, he/she starts the KYC process and bring his/her support on certain points.
OTHERS


Conduct

 He/She ensures that the business carried out with his/her clients is appropriate, understandable and suitable.
 He/She acts in a product-neutral manner in the best interest of the clients and of the BNP Paribas Group globally
 He/She respects the BNP Paribas Code of Conduct in all listed key responsibilities.
 CSR:
 He/She ensures consistent and comprehensive enforcement of BNP Paribas CSR policies and procedures


REQUISITOS

Studies

 Degree in Finance and/or Economics and/or Accounting with a strong knowledge of financial analysis under several standards (IFRS, local)
 Mifid qualification (CNMV Standars) not mandatory but highly reccomended


Experience

At least one year experience in Banking

Languages

High level of English

Skills

 Good knowledge of the Corporate banking environment
 Detail oriented with a solid knowledge of financial analysis
 MS Pack Office
 Communication skills
 Analystical Ability
 Critical thinking


B

ENEFITS

 Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.
 Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).
 Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.
 Flexible compensation plan.
 Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).
 31 vacation days.


Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.
GROUP BNP PARIBAS
About The Job
COMMERCIAL
He/She supports the Banker in the preparation and follow up of the Strategic Business Review:
He/She prepares the Strategic Business review and send it to participants
He/She attends the Strategic Business review and writes the minutes
He/She is responsible for the preparation of budget / forecasts in liaison with the contributors
He/She contributes to the identification of the client needs and discusses with the Banker
 MNCs business coordination:
Local contributors:
He/She creates and updates contact list
He/She identifies relevant client in the portfolio & spot opportunities across geographies
Business Groups contributors’s network:
He/She prepares and updates stakeholders on the Commercial Strategy with the Group
He/She displays minutes of the Reviews, gather feedbacks
He/She schedules the network call & prepare the agenda, feed CRM
Origination/Sales:
He/She maps BG international presence (Org Chart) & local activities
He/She creates and maintains a list of prospects and new clients
He/She gathers information from client / prospects
He/She prepares client meetings (extract fiche client…) and defines topics to be addressed
He/She contributes to client events, calls & meetings, sales/deal related client/prospect interactions
He/She develops presentation/pitches
He/She coordinates pitch document and the rehearsal in interaction with the banker
He/She prepares forecasts based on client business plan and measures impacts of major opportunities on clients financials (when no other Métier involved)
He/She monitors the pipeline and spots client / prospects business opportunities in regards to each products and alerts/discusses with the Banker / team
He/She is encouraged to build junior relationships with the client
 Complex Client Request:
He/She performs a due diligence based on technical documents : RFP, Financial Information in liaison with Banker & BL
He/She gathers relevant document (incl. Preliminary financial information) and sends question list
He/She negociates NDA with the client
He/She supports the Banker in the RFP analysis and deal structuration with the support of the SCA
He/She prepares screening committee
He/She attends the screening discussion on deal with management, Delegation holder and Business Line
 2. CREDIT
 Under the accountability of the Banker(s), and in coordination with the ECA platform, the Coverage Analyst, using his/her credit expertize, will be in charge of the following tasks:
 Monitoring of the overall risks of a portfolio of Pilot Groups (Credit/Counterparty, Compliance and CSR) with the Senior Credit Advisor support:
He/She is responsible for watching & anticipating risks/events at Group level
He/She is responsible for alerting the Banker in case of change(s) and issue(s)
He/She is responsible for regularly updating stakeholders (including ECA) via a one Pager
He/She contributes to the TGA discussion (AR process)
He/She contributes to the management of Resources allocated to their client portfolio, i.e. RWA, CDS, Insurance, …
 Green light process:
He/She is responsible for validating the criteria for denotching/propagation
He/She is informed of any issue on a Business Group contributor by the ECA or the ECH
He/She is responsible for the monitoring of the efficient use of lines (GL responses)
 Credit process of Pilot files:
He/She conducts a sanity check of the Credit Proposal prepared by the ECA
He/She is responsible for the analysis & drafting of the Client Relationship and the deal/risk return part of the Credit Proposal
He/She writes a recommendation on the file/deal (or an executive summary in case of CCDG file)
He/She attends Credit Committee together with the Banker
He/She is responsible for organizing a kick off meeting with the Banker and the ECA (+SCA when needed) for Annual Reviews and relevant New Requests
 Structuring - for plain vanilla products / loan book:
He/She contributes to the discussion on terms and conditions with the client
He/She liaises with Legal on Terms and Conditions
 Contracting plain vanilla products / loan book (and, in option, for structured loan with the Business line when requested):
He/She contributes to the final negotiation:
He/She seeks internal approvals (i) from Risk or CC if changes vs credit decision (ii) from compliance if any change in term of sanctions/AML (iii) from other departments such as Assets and Liquidity Management and Treasury or Legal if certain policy requirements have not been met in the contracts
He/She is responsible for the credit process of amendment to initial credit decision, ECA preparing the Credit Paper
He/She coordinates the review of Sanction wording
 Deal implementation & life cycle:
He/She is responsible for deal implementation and follow up of its life cycle in coordination with product partners / contributor RM/RO, Middle office…
He/She is responsible for the follow up of the Covenants
 Others:
He/She prepares the watch list fiche, the GRR spreadsheet (update : closure) and the CSR screening
He/She attends watch List/Doubtful committee jointly with the Banker

KYC
He/She supports bankers in steering the KYC Strategy for their client portfolio for both onboarding (raise onboarding request, share priorities with other actors), recertification (conduct profitability review) and trigger event, in consistency with the Credit Process whenever relevant.
 He/She ensures a comprehensive identification of clients’ business needs and the related KYC flag set-up between Primary and Secondary sites in line with Passport and Reliance procedures.
 He/She maintains a close contact with KYC Coordinators / E2E Coordinators / BG Coordinator (whomever relevant) for clients under their responsibility
 He/She informs clients of BNPP KYC process and connects them to the proper KYC Operations SPOC
 By delegation of banker, he/she can prepare call memos, analyze screening hits and complete RMs assessment for any KYC file and can contribute, in limited cases, to the collection of clients’ sensitive documents.
 He/She ensures Compliance with Bank’s policies and regulatory requirements.
 In particular, he/she ensures KYC is in place and up to date for all clients. When necessary, he/she starts the KYC process and bring his/her support on certain points.

4176445815.title: Finance Analyst Intern
4176445815.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
En Impulsa CFO, apoyamos a Corporates, Startups, Fondos de VC/PE y PYMES con soluciones financieras estratégicas y operativas.

Si te interesan las finanzas y quieres aprender trabajando con empresas reales, buscamos un Finance Analyst Intern para incorporarse a nuestro equipo.

¿Qué harás?

Apoyar en el análisis financiero y la construcción de modelos en Excel.Colaborar en la preparación de reportes financieros y métricas clave para clientes.Dar soporte en procesos operativos y estratégicos en diferentes industrias.Participar en el seguimiento de inversiones y la preparación de información para fondos y startups.Ayudar en tareas contables y de control financiero según necesidades de los clientes. ¿Qué buscamos en ti?

Estudiante o recién graduado en ADE, Economía, Finanzas o carreras afines.Excel avanzado, incluyendo modelización financiera.Mentalidad analítica, autonomía y ganas de aprender.Inglés es un plus. ¿Qué ofrecemos?

Prácticas remuneradas con flexibilidad entre 20 y 35 horas semanales.Posibilidad de contratación al finalizar las prácticas.Aprendizaje en un entorno dinámico con clientes de distintos sectores.Oportunidad de trabajar en proyectos de alto impacto en el ecosistema financiero. ¿Te interesa?

Envíanos tu CV a ****** con el asunto: Finance Analyst Intern – [Tu Nombre]

4167172371.title: Pricing Analyst
4167172371.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Analista de Pricing Grupo FireSobre Grupo Fire:Grupo Fire es un líder destacado en la industria de protección contra incendios en España, contando con más de 300 profesionales, una base de clientes que supera los 50,000, y operaciones en seis regiones.

Conocidos por nuestro compromiso con la seguridad y la calidad, estamos en constante expansión y evolución para satisfacer las necesidades de nuestros clientes y del mercado.Estamos creciendo y en 2025 seremos la principal compañía de protección contra incendios en España.Descripción del Puesto:Buscamos un Analista de Pricing Estratégico que se especialice en la utilización de grandes bases de datos de clientes para identificar patrones de precios y oportunidades de optimización.

Este rol es clave para maximizar la rentabilidad y retención de clientes mediante ajustes estratégicos en la estructura de precios.Responsabilidades Clave:Analizar extensas bases de datos de clientes para identificar patrones y tendencias en precios por tipo de cliente, servicio, área geográfica y tamaño de cliente.Desarrollar modelos predictivos para determinar oportunidades de incremento de precios y evaluar el impacto potencial en la retención y rentabilidad.Trabajar en conjunto con los equipos de operaciones y comerciales para implementar aumentos de precios y asegurar su aceptación en el mercado.Monitorizar y evaluar el impacto de los ajustes de precios en la retención de clientes y la rentabilidad global de la empresa.Realizar seguimiento continuo y análisis de la correlación entre incrementos de precios y cambios en la dinámica del mercado y comportamiento del cliente.Calificaciones:Título universitario en Economía, Finanzas, Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería Industrial o campo relacionado.Al menos 3-5 años de experiencia en análisis de datos o roles analíticos financieros, con un fuerte enfoque en análisis de bases de datos grandes.Experiencia específica en roles de pricing, incluyendo el desarrollo de estrategias de precios y evaluación de su efectividad.Experiencia en modelado de datos, análisis predictivo y herramientas analíticas avanzadas.Competencia comprobada para trabajar con datos complejos y realizar análisis cuantitativos detallados.Excelentes habilidades comunicativas, con fluidez en español e inglés.Lo Que Ofrecemos:Salario competitivo con compensación variable basada en el rendimiento.Oportunidades de crecimiento acelerado en una empresa que está expandiendo su tamaño anualmente.Un ambiente colaborativo con un equipo de alto calibre.Formación continua y oportunidades de desarrollo profesional.Proceso de Aplicación:Los candidatos interesados deben enviar su currículum y una carta de presentación explicando sus calificaciones e interés en el puesto a ******ón: Barcelona o Madrid, EspañaTipo de Contrato: Tiempo completo, IndefinidoFecha de Inicio: Inmediata

4176443970.title: Finance Analyst Intern
4176443970.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
En Impulsa CFO, apoyamos a Corporates, Startups, Fondos de VC/PE y PYMES con soluciones financieras estratégicas y operativas.

Si te interesan las finanzas y quieres aprender trabajando con empresas reales, buscamos un Finance Analyst Intern para incorporarse a nuestro equipo.

¿Qué harás?

Apoyar en el análisis financiero y la construcción de modelos en Excel.Colaborar en la preparación de reportes financieros y métricas clave para clientes.Dar soporte en procesos operativos y estratégicos en diferentes industrias.Participar en el seguimiento de inversiones y la preparación de información para fondos y startups.Ayudar en tareas contables y de control financiero según necesidades de los clientes. ¿Qué buscamos en ti?

Estudiante o recién graduado en ADE, Economía, Finanzas o carreras afines.Excel avanzado, incluyendo modelización financiera.Mentalidad analítica, autonomía y ganas de aprender.Inglés es un plus. ¿Qué ofrecemos?

Prácticas remuneradas con flexibilidad entre 20 y 35 horas semanales.Posibilidad de contratación al finalizar las prácticas.Aprendizaje en un entorno dinámico con clientes de distintos sectores.Oportunidad de trabajar en proyectos de alto impacto en el ecosistema financiero. ¿Te interesa?

Envíanos tu CV a ****** con el asunto: Finance Analyst Intern – [Tu Nombre]

4167173484.title: Pricing Analyst
4167173484.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
Analista de Pricing Grupo FireSobre Grupo Fire:Grupo Fire es un líder destacado en la industria de protección contra incendios en España, contando con más de 300 profesionales, una base de clientes que supera los 50,000, y operaciones en seis regiones.

Conocidos por nuestro compromiso con la seguridad y la calidad, estamos en constante expansión y evolución para satisfacer las necesidades de nuestros clientes y del mercado.Estamos creciendo y en 2025 seremos la principal compañía de protección contra incendios en España.Descripción del Puesto:Buscamos un Analista de Pricing Estratégico que se especialice en la utilización de grandes bases de datos de clientes para identificar patrones de precios y oportunidades de optimización.

Este rol es clave para maximizar la rentabilidad y retención de clientes mediante ajustes estratégicos en la estructura de precios.Responsabilidades Clave:Analizar extensas bases de datos de clientes para identificar patrones y tendencias en precios por tipo de cliente, servicio, área geográfica y tamaño de cliente.Desarrollar modelos predictivos para determinar oportunidades de incremento de precios y evaluar el impacto potencial en la retención y rentabilidad.Trabajar en conjunto con los equipos de operaciones y comerciales para implementar aumentos de precios y asegurar su aceptación en el mercado.Monitorizar y evaluar el impacto de los ajustes de precios en la retención de clientes y la rentabilidad global de la empresa.Realizar seguimiento continuo y análisis de la correlación entre incrementos de precios y cambios en la dinámica del mercado y comportamiento del cliente.Calificaciones:Título universitario en Economía, Finanzas, Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería Industrial o campo relacionado.Al menos 3-5 años de experiencia en análisis de datos o roles analíticos financieros, con un fuerte enfoque en análisis de bases de datos grandes.Experiencia específica en roles de pricing, incluyendo el desarrollo de estrategias de precios y evaluación de su efectividad.Experiencia en modelado de datos, análisis predictivo y herramientas analíticas avanzadas.Competencia comprobada para trabajar con datos complejos y realizar análisis cuantitativos detallados.Excelentes habilidades comunicativas, con fluidez en español e inglés.Lo Que Ofrecemos:Salario competitivo con compensación variable basada en el rendimiento.Oportunidades de crecimiento acelerado en una empresa que está expandiendo su tamaño anualmente.Un ambiente colaborativo con un equipo de alto calibre.Formación continua y oportunidades de desarrollo profesional.Proceso de Aplicación:Los candidatos interesados deben enviar su currículum y una carta de presentación explicando sus calificaciones e interés en el puesto a ******ón: Barcelona o Madrid, EspañaTipo de Contrato: Tiempo completo, IndefinidoFecha de Inicio: Inmediata

4176450029.title: Finance Analyst Intern
4176450029.description:
About the job
This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More
En Impulsa CFO, apoyamos a Corporates, Startups, Fondos de VC/PE y PYMES con soluciones financieras estratégicas y operativas.

Si te interesan las finanzas y quieres aprender trabajando con empresas reales, buscamos un Finance Analyst Intern para incorporarse a nuestro equipo.

¿Qué harás?

Apoyar en el análisis financiero y la construcción de modelos en Excel.Colaborar en la preparación de reportes financieros y métricas clave para clientes.Dar soporte en procesos operativos y estratégicos en diferentes industrias.Participar en el seguimiento de inversiones y la preparación de información para fondos y startups.Ayudar en tareas contables y de control financiero según necesidades de los clientes. ¿Qué buscamos en ti?

Estudiante o recién graduado en ADE, Economía, Finanzas o carreras afines.Excel avanzado, incluyendo modelización financiera.Mentalidad analítica, autonomía y ganas de aprender.Inglés es un plus. ¿Qué ofrecemos?

Prácticas remuneradas con flexibilidad entre 20 y 35 horas semanales.Posibilidad de contratación al finalizar las prácticas.Aprendizaje en un entorno dinámico con clientes de distintos sectores.Oportunidad de trabajar en proyectos de alto impacto en el ecosistema financiero. ¿Te interesa?

Envíanos tu CV a ****** con el asunto: Finance Analyst Intern – [Tu Nombre]

4172919021.title: Business Analyst Gesetzliche Krankenversicherung (all genders)
4172919021.description:
About the job
Wir gehören zu den Top-Adressen in der IT-Welt und fokussieren uns auf die Optimierung der Kerngeschäftsprozesse unserer Kunden. Durch den smarten Einsatz maßgeschneiderter IT-Lösungen unterstützen wir unsere Kunden dabei, das Beste aus ihrem Business und aktuellen Technologien herauszuholen. Unseren Erfolg aber erreichen wir nur durch eins: die Menschen bei adesso! Sie bringen Ideen, fachliches Know how und Technologien zusammen. Gemeinsam programmieren wir (deine) Zukunft bei adesso.

DEINE ROLLE

Gestalte Prozesse: Du definierst und modellierst Prozesse, Komponenten und Systeme bei unseren namhaften Kunden in der Gesetzlichen Krankenversicherung.
Berate Kunden: Du entwickelst Lösungen, die regulatorische Vorgaben aus dem Sozialgesetzbuch zuverlässig berücksichtigen.
Begleite Workshops: Du planst Workshops, moderierst sie und sorgst für eine strukturierte Nachbereitung.
Projekte vorantreiben: Du unterstützt bei Tests, Abnahmen und setzt gemeinsam mit deinem Team Projektziele um.
Sales Support: Du beteiligst dich aktiv an der Kundenakquise und stärkst unsere Geschäftsbeziehungen.

DEIN PROFIL

Berufserfahrung: Du hast Erfahrung in der gesetzlichen Krankenversicherung und IT-Kompetenz.
Anforderungsmanagement: Du bringst methodische und praktische Erfahrung in Anforderungsmanagement und Anforderungsdefinition mit.
Produktkenntnisse: Du kennst Produkte des Gesundheitswesens und Branchensoftware-Systeme wie BITMARCK_21c|ng, oscare®, TKeasy.
Sprachkenntnisse: Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse

Unser Versprechen: Du wirst dich bei uns wohlfühlen! Kollegial, familiär und auf Augenhöhe – wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Diversität und verschiedene Blickwinkel werden bei uns genauso geschätzt wie du als Mensch. Das und viel mehr steht für unser ganz besonderes Wir-Gefühl. Für das es sogar ein Wort gibt: adessi.

Unsere Kultur und das Zusammenarbeiten sind geprägt von gegenseitiger Wertschätzung, Anerkennung und Unterstützung. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So belegen wir zum wiederholten Mal den 1. Platz beim Wettbewerb „Deutschlands Beste Arbeitgeber in der ITK“!. Unser umfangreiches Trainingsangebot und ein transparentes Laufbahnstufenmodell für alle sorgen dafür, dass deine Entwicklung bei uns nicht stillsteht. Denn gemeinsam zu wachsen und Chancengeber zu sein, das ist programmiert in unserer DNA.
DEINE ROLLE
Gestalte Prozesse: Du definierst und modellierst Prozesse, Komponenten und Systeme bei unseren namhaften Kunden in der Gesetzlichen Krankenversicherung.
Berate Kunden: Du entwickelst Lösungen, die regulatorische Vorgaben aus dem Sozialgesetzbuch zuverlässig berücksichtigen.

Sales Support: Du beteiligst dich aktiv an der Kundenakquise und stärkst unsere Geschäftsbeziehungen.
